x8_7bc96ItXd1Emzpawpyw.text: I heartily recommend this restaurant. Our party of 6 had a variety of tapas and paella. Every dish was flavorful, well prepared and well presented. Our favorites were the Crispy Beef, Churasco, Olives, Paella and Stuffed Peppers. The plate of 3 different ham selections was also tasty!  This was our first time and we will definitely go back.

U2jeU5rf0Tl3SrObsy2FYA.text: Amazing food. Every dish was outstanding. So good I came back 3 nights in a row. Dishes are nice size and every one was yummy. Particularly liked the steak and lamb dishes. Great service

0Oo8DF0ylMWiSQ0v7LHeMQ.text: Very good tapas with a friendly, very fast staff.  Really good on a saturday night when the city was flooded with St Paddy's Day people.   Everythinhg we sampled was well prepped.  I have to go back to try the paella..

qfbKoUN02mkNf5OLA6U7Lg.text: Very very good.  As i remember living in Spain just a bit more refined.  Warm feeling. Good service.  Great food.  Love it.   Best. Stephen.

BgycE3H4ff1f-dCH1pXJOQ.text: Without a doubt, this is tops for Uptown.  As authentic Spanish food as you'll taste outside of Spain (and I've been there recently).  Great service at tables and at the small bar, terrific selections of Spanish wines, comfortable setting (not too big, not too cramped) and of course the Spanish food is very delicious.

Yst6CrEo2N7K-jYIMSYn8Q.text: I love Spanish food and Malabar did not disappoint.  Had the Croquetas, Sangria and Datiles (delicious special that night).  The food and drink was excellent.  The croquetas had potato, manchego cheese and serrano ham.  Quite the yummy treat.  Sangria... well, who doesn't like a good sangria?  The datiles was a delicous sweet treat that eliminated the need for dessert since it consisted of dates as the primary part of the dish.  Very friendly staff, nice location with an outside patio.  Definitely will go back for more.

SkdgqdOZWN_Yo_YtzEO89g.text: Best paella in Charlotte.  The sangria is great.  I have been here a couple times and have never been disappointed.  Sit at the bar if you want good conversation with the diverse crowd and cool bartenders.

oNq4fKdqUXFEqFo8x1P43A.text: Awesome I had such a great time at Malabar this past weekend.  They have a great little patio outside that is ideal for some Uptown people watching.  I enjoyed some great wine with outstanding service.  Out waiter was patient and friendly he gave us some great recommendations and we really enjoyed our food. The menu has lots to offer from traditional Spanish tapas to paella.  Next time I am going to try one of their paella's they take about 35 minutes to make since they are made to order they all sounded fantastic.  There is a great selection of spanish meats and cheeses as well as several grilled octopus dishes.  This place is truly unique I can't wait to go back.

MZYlyxgLdXDn-YZ8Vd8ccg.text: Great food! Great service! Try the sangria and ask how they make it! Great recipe !! We had the Vaca Frieta for app and aaaahhhazzzing !!!!

cRUQF5ZV-8uaCcI4qYcY0w.text: We stopped here on a whim looking for something to eat before going to the Belk Theatre.   There were a number of expected tapas and some new ones to try as well.   Everything was really good!

RCE7JUoPb5IXX0VL2wXBwA.text: Love coming here from the atmosphere to the service and above all else the food. Spent Valentine's here and nothing cheesy. Great paella and wine list. Just wish they carried potato vodka to complement the excellent selection of gluten free options.

n2zeozMYCQqyAUJ6Y32iGQ.text: Malabar was very dissapointing we walked in and were welcomed by a nice toun lady but then after that everything went down hill , our server took out drink orders and sent the very nice buss girls to take it .he then came back took our order and never came back to ask us how it was ,instead the buss girl was refillin waters getting us extra sauce and lemons .we ordered patatas bravas ,calamari, and Gambas they were OK nothing to go back for and it's was 18 for 6 shrimps which I thought was ridiculous . We left very dissapointed with the server but I do have to say the buss girls were awesome!

ENDNw3iMsEXgKAvI6aJPYg.text: We have eaten here twice, both times with other couples.  Food is perfectly seasoned prepared perfectly.  Service is very good, we were asked if we had show tickets and needed to eat quickly. The beef empanadas are delicious, as are the cruquettas.  Seafood paella was outstanding and a generous portion for the 4 of us.  Flavoring right on, rice perfectly cooked and sauced.  Seafood also cooked perfectly.  Reservations are a must as the place is small. and  It can be a bit noisy.  The white sangria did not have much taste, but the red was excellent.  Prices are reasonable for the quality.  We would have liked to see 4 tapas on a plate rather than 3, as both times there were 4 people at our table.

X_ld5U2W4fngIPH5__kWcQ.text: I eat here a few times a month, both for lunch and for dinner. I love the small plates, you can share or not, either way your getting great food. The tapas here is by far my favorite thing, I love all the options and I don't like to eat a ton before going out so this is my spot to hit when I'm showing people around or meeting up with friends. I love how small it is inside, it goes with the small plates and gives a more personalized feel, and if it is nice ouside please sit on their patio, the music from the Hearst area is always different and talk about a date night spot, this is it. The staff is great and always smiling, I've never to this day have had a bad meal, or experience, so please keep up the good work! :)

m8sLo072A9SszAcwI3YE3g.text: I really think that 18$ for gambas is too expensive, 6 pieces of shrimp, that's too pricey. Anyways, Our server came once to ask us for our food and never came back again. Instead our lovely buss girls did all the service! The food was ok! The biggest disappointment overall was the way the server treated the buss girl! He probably didn't know we spoke Spanish, but we clearly understood everything. After all she was the one who did all the work!

Ubl30dckNk5KtKla3i-l7w.text: Ok, maybe the chef read my review because a couple of weeks ago I went to Malabar and what to my wondering eyes should appear? Sauteed spinach and chickpeas in a saffron broth. With garlic bits floating around. Oh yes, I have found it. Thank you!! Also, I tried their seafood paella for the first time and it is a must try for those who have never had paella and want to experience the real deal. Keep up the AWESOME work, Malabar.

Y5PzwvUlZ05u4gKHQtRxkw.text: We really loved Malabar when it first opened but the last time we went it wasn't the same.  The service wasnt great and the food was not as good.  I don't know if they are under new management or hopefully it was just an off night.    We will give it another try I'm sure,  but it was a Friday night and there plenty of tables available so I'm guessing this is a trend.

pHzOCyLrO3zI__nKwaRi5A.text: As far as the food goes, it's decent, but not anything to go out of your way for.  As far as the service goes, it's horrible!  The manager is rude!!!  I cannot believe the way we treated during our most recent visit.  We waited for an hour for a table, despite having a reservation.  We will not be returning.

0obwB6hklrqiscqyzAFlPA.text: We've walked by Malabar, the red-roofed Spanish tapas restaurant on Tryon, many nights and have always wanted to try it out.  This past Saturday, we finally decided to make reservations and stop in for a late supper.  We were easily able to hold a place for 5 on Open Table (props to the Yelp app for making that so simple) and were pleasantly surprised that Charlotte Restaurant Week began the night before.   One of the most obvious and notable characteristics of Malabar is the authenticity they are striving to achieve with the Spanish tapas experience...to the point that the menus had to be explained to us more than one time.  Now I didn't view this as a negative.  Our server was extremely knowledgeable of the items served on the menu and made excellent recommendations, both on food and wine.  They brought out fresh bread with high quality olive oil for dipping before the first course began.   During the menu de-brief, our server explained that the Restaurant Week menu featured 2 small tapas plates, 1 entree, and 1 dessert.  The only difference he pointed out between that and the normal menu was the portion sizes, of course the Restaurant Week menu's would be smaller due to the amount included in the overall meal.  I went for the Vaca Frita (slow cooked beef that is slightly fried for crispness with caramelized onions) and the Champinones (sauteed wild mushrooms) for the first course.  Both of these were recommended by our server and turned out to be absolutely delicious.  The serving of mushrooms was so large the entire table each had some with their tapas choices.  Everyone around the table was also extremely satisfied with their choices, from the Canelones (rolled pasta with chicken and covered in cheese) to the Pulpo (grilled octopus with olives).  By the time we finished the first round, no one was quite sure how we would begin to finish the 2nd, much less the desserts.   I was completely shocked by the portion brought out for our entree.  I ordered the Gambas al Ajo (sauteed garlic shrimp) and they were probably some of the largest shrimp I've ever seen...and there were 5 of them.  Plus potatoes with chili powder on them...with 2 types of sauces.  There was so much food I had 2 shrimp left over.  I tried to pass them off to my fellow diners but they were just as full from their entrees.  Two others ordered the Churrasco (grilled skirt steak with Chimichurri) and also raved about how delicious everything came out.    Throw in the red sangria and multiple glasses of Spanish red wine that we had with our huge meal and everyone was ready to go to bed.  And then...the dessert came out.  I ordered the Cafe Chocolate.  Man o man. It was absurdly delicious.  I could've eaten an entire tub of that for dinner and been equally happy with the experience.  In a glass there was a layer of chocolate mousse, topped with a layer of coffee mousse, and topped with these lovely dark chocolate curls.  It was to die for. Incredibly delicious. I cannot rave enough about that dessert. It was obscene. Stop what you are doing and go right now to get one. You will thank me later.   Overall, the food at Malabar was absolutely excellent.  The only reason I did not award 5 stars was due to the amount of time it took for each round of food to come out.  I'm sure this was just a classic Saturday night in Uptown, but by the time checks were signed and we were ready to go the entire evening took over 2 and a half hours.    Despite the somewhat slow dinner experience, Malabar is an absolute must try next time you dine out in Charlotte.  Take the recommendations from the servers (they know what they are talking about) and don't you dare leave without trying the Cafe Chocolate....so good.

09sr3XFzkQdsw-gphRRf_Q.text: I had high hopes for this place. We came here for restaurant week & I was impressed with the atmosphere & decor. But to be honest, the food fell short for me. The only thing I actually loved was the cilantro sauce they give for dipping w/ yucca. It was heavenly. Everything else I ordered was just ok.

vsPY33BHXIcYp7CWgyo-Nw.text: I really cannot emphasize enough how mediocre this place is. Meatballs were very smoky and the sauce was rather one note. The rice was very well cooked (fluffy) but entirely lacked seasoning. The paella only had shrimp (as opposed to a mix of seafood). The sandwiches heavily favored bread in their bread to meat ratio. The papas bravas were average - the potatoes had obviously been reheated and the aioli was WAY too garlicky (not balanced). The tiramisu was the highlight of my meal, but on par with what you could get at the grocery store. The churros were over cooked and biscotti texture, just oily. I went with a group of 11 and approximately 4 in the group would go back.

YDCLnWuH4n37LCPueXdzMg.text: The decor, the service, the food was all phenomenal. Not one complaint. The bread came with really high quality evoo. Delicious! Good call on not adding herbs to the dipping bowl. We had the cheese plate, (get the big one,) sherry mushrooms and goat cheese salad, (ok, 1 complaint- there was only 1 croquet in my salad... was expecting three or four,) and Spanish Meatballs. Wish we could've stayed all day and just ordered everything on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Topped my goat cheese salad with a sherry vinaigrette with my mushrooms in sherry wine.

6Ah1MJcBs_MHYTCsnzDMUA.text: I wanted to like this place SO bad.   I am visiting from NJ & woke up craving skirt steak, so I picked this restaurant based on the 4 star rating. My BF and I arrived & the host immediately asked if we had reservations, we did not, but she sat us anyway with ONE menu, promising she'd bring a 2nd one when it became avail. The restaurant was full when we sat down, maybe about 4 open tables.  About 2 min later a bus lady came and filled our water in silence.... That was it... For about 10 min. I looked at my watch and I tell the BF "If we have to wait 10 more min. we are walking out." 5 minutes later, the bus lady brings out bread & fills our water.. Again in COMPLETE silence.   At this point, no one has said a word to us, not even a "Hey someone will be right with you."  But by this time, half the restaurant was gone and 4 new tables sat. No one brings our 2nd menu, and there is one server that keeps looking at us but continues to walk right by us and says nothing.   15 minutes have passed from the time the bus lady brought bread which my BF has almost finished, he looks at me and says "ready?" I grab my purse when the same host finally comes up and plainly says "Do you know what you want to drink?" At this point my blood started to boil.   Not a "sorry you've been waiting 25 min." Not a "Hey! Hope the bread was ok, we've been swamped." Nope. NOTHING.   I look at her and say -  "You know we have been sitting here more than 25 minutes and no one has said a word to us." She stops and thinks for 2 seconds & replies with "we are short staffed today and are doing the best we can."  Me- "I totally get that, but that's no reason not to even acknowledge someone is sitting here." I tell her I've been a server over 7 years & what she just said was no excuse. And finish with "I think we are going to go." The BF grabs the last piece of bread as we get up (I thought it was quite funny!!) and we walk out.   I wanted so badly to like this place... But I will NEVER be back here. I've been in the restaurant industry 7 years and I know what being busy is and how EASY it is to acknowledge someone. Because of that I always tip well, even when I have shitty service. But there was no way I'd spend my money here. Neither should you.

vhSBOOD_cLx5vOwxFziQpg.text: We like the idea of tapas and now we like the ides of Malabar. We liked the food,  the service and the ambience. I wish it was in Greensboro.

_W726LevERsIwY4ohqgTJA.text: Had a business meeting today uptown and both of us had been dying to try out Malabar, so we decided to talk over lunch! We arrived pretty early, at 11:45am, and were the only ones in the restaurant for the first 30 minutes.  Everything from the atmosphere to the service and the food to the prices was right on point. The two of us decided to skip the entrees and just order several tapas so we could try more of the items on the menu, and as far as I'm concerned, this is the only way to go at a Tapas/Small Plates restaurant.   We ordered the ham and manchego croquetas, pan con tomate (tomato bread), tortilla Espanola, and Pimentones Rellenos (stuffed peppers). Everything was delicious, but the croquetas and tomato bread were the real highlights. The croquetas were rich yet light and fluffy and just melted in your mouth, we ended up ordering a second helping after we finished all of our food! The tomato bread is a Spanish mystery to me, to be able to take 3 such simple ingredients (bread, tomatoes, and olive oil) and combine them into something so incredibly flavorful and delicious takes real skill and very high quality ingredients.   We ended up ordering 5 tapas (plus the free bread and olive oil that they bring to each table) and it was more than enough food for two people. We were shocked when our bill came out to $23; definitely can't do much better than that for a lunch of this caliber uptown!  I will 100% visit Malabar again to try out the rest of their tapas and some of their desserts!

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Manchego and Serrano ham croquetas!
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tortilla Española
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Champiñones (sautéed mushrooms) they were SO flavorful and delicious on the bread!

l8YGFEhsYQEVgEoq6-af2g.text: Visited Malabar today to try their tapas selection and was pleased overall with everything. We had a reservation and arrived early so it wasn't too crowded at the beginning, but the small seating area filled up as the evening went on!  The food overall was solid with some dishes that were excellent and some that were just okay. My date and I tried six items total. -Clams: the clams themselves were okay and the broth was very flavorful; the chorizo in the broth was the real star here though surprisingly and was outstanding! -Stuffed peppers: the peppers were delicious and filled with a delicious cheese and rice mixture; highly recommended especially for vegetarians.  -Lamb chops: very strong lemon flavor, not bad overall but 3 chops not worth the $17 price -Beef Empanadas: crispy coating and pretty flavorful beef filling. They were a solid option but only getting 2 to an order I would recommend trying other choices instead -Croquetas: AMAZING! The ham, cheese and potato filling is ridiculously good and these were definitely the favorite item. -Tres leches cake: we didn't order this but one of the servers brought it out to us FOR FREE just for coming in and ordering food.   Overall the food was good and the service was outstanding! Our waters were constantly refilled and the food came out pretty quickly. The free cake we received was just a bonus of the impeccable service here. The prices are a little high for the portions (as with all tapas places in my opinion) but I'd highly recommend Malabar if you're looking to try a tapas experience in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Complimentary tres leches cake!
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Clams with chorizo broth
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. One of three lamb chops

_bEhOIqODsPMuP0vqTkb6A.text: These are all Tapas and the portions are a lot more than the Tapas I'm used in Barcelona; however, the food is just as good.  We had a little of everything and I tell you I can't wait to go back and try more.  The service was excellent and our waiter was constantly checking to make sure we're OK.  I would highly recommend trying this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulpit or octopus.  This was good.

Anwh3x2pjwJAutDfXVsDTA.text: We ate here last night for the first time. We love tapas and had high hopes. When we have eaten tapas in the past (at many different restaurants) the server or host host has spent time going over the menu. Suggested pairings and explained dishes.   Last night at Malabar we were on our own. No friendly chit chat, no menu assistance. Frankly we did not know who our server was. One took out drink order another took the order and yet another brought the food.   No one asked if we wanted a second round of drinks (we did). No one asked how the food was prepared (competently but not great - don't get the scallops - grossly over cooked) and we were rushed out.

tfUbo_phC5idbVU-rJ7Chg.text: We enjoyed the wine and the service was good.  But the food was not so great. The stuffed peppers were good, but could have been done from frozen.  The mussels had a bad smell and the other tapas just left something to be desired, especially for the price.  The ambiance was good; but we won't be back.

utvSp4gtd8ARQAXmkD9n5A.text: Wednesday night Feb 4th, my boyfriend and I live in Huntersville and we wanted to try some place new after a long day of work.  I saw this place and it had great reviews. Went online and made reservations for 2 at 9pm and received  an email confirmation for the reservation... We got there at 9 on the dot and they were closed... Their website says they close at 10... WTF!!!! I called them to make sure that I wasn't crazy and that I saw 10pm on their website... They told me they had closed early Bc it was slow. Wtf then why would you confirm reservations online if you closed early. Soooooooo disappointed...

YbNqLOGmR0_UTYpkfKeWyg.text: One of the best paella outside of Spain. Sangria was so refreshing and delicious. The choices for tapas are incredible. I highly recommend the yuca frites.

FCGNw_cQp7-8NutURqZKzA.text: I went for restaurant week.  The atmosphere was great and so was the service. The tapas were amazing. I went with 3 other people and we order 8 tapas. All of them were great. I ordered the carne paella. I was a fan of it. The rice was undercooked and some of the meat (ribs, and chicken) were dry and over cooked. I am not sure if this was because of restaurant week or what. The conejo was ok as well. The gambas were great. I would go back for the tapas (especially the  grilled calamari).

mxstibSmIOTMuz74tqiouw.text: I occassionally go to malabar because i love spanish tapas and there arent many options for that in charlotte. however, i dont think i can quite put it in four star territory both because ive had higher quality tapas in other cities and because of some customer service issues.   i think it is best to go to Malabar at lunchtime. You save money this way and although the food is good, its not good enough to pay big money for. Save the big money for tapas places in larger cities (The Iberian Pig in Atlanta and Amada in Philly come to mind). Also, the best item on Malabar's menu is only served at lunch-the torta sandwich. It has albondigas,avocado, manchego cheese, and a spicy paprika sauce on it and the combination of these ingredients is amazing. the papas braves that come on the side are fantastic as well especially with the aforementioned paparika sauce. The various cured meats are usually very good and are on both the lunch and dinner menu.   On the dinner menu, there are both tapas and larger entrees but I would urge people to stay away from the entrees because theyre priced a bit unfairly. The name 'entree' is very misleading. Many of their entrees arent much bigger than the small plate options yet cost at least twice as much!   Unfortunately, Ive had some bad experiences with customer service at Malabar. When i went a few days ago, my server was very rude and couldnt answer even basic questions about the menu. Two of the cheeses on their cheese plate werent familiar to me so I asked him about what sort of cheeses they were. He looked at me as if I was a complete idiot and said 'uh cheese. what do you mean what kind of cheeses?". Im sorry but thats just inexcusable. If you work at a Spanish tapas place, you should be able to give a brief description of the cheeses since thats a pretty important part of the tapas experience! Even though he couldnt tell me much about the cheeses, I took the risk and ordered the cheese plate anyway. Two of the cheeses were good, one tasted like plastic. The service also tends to be slow.  The bottom line: This place works to satisfy my fix when Im craving tapas but if Charlotte had more tapas options, it likely wouldnt be at the top of my list

6Tt0xvq7v1gCugpkmXCkPQ.text: Completely in love with this place. Everything was good but the croquetas OMG was delicious!!! Definetly i will come back soon...

nb_yziso52uV62an-wk7Cw.text: Tapas, nothing less!  I always enjoy going to tapas restaurants because given the miniscule size of each dish, chefs tend to go the extra mile to make the food stand out. In many ways, these Spanish style dishes are among the most powerful because you can clearly taste the flavors that are baked, grilled or fried right into the main protein or ingredient (smaller serving dishes implies more concentrated flavors).  Malabar has a few great instances of this, namely their Paella and Croquetas. Paella takes ~35 min to make, but if you're looking for something fresh, this is the only place that's going to do it for you in uptown. A fresh paella takes awhile and when you receive the finished product (photo), you'll understand why. I tried the Paella Royale, which came with a wide assortment of fish, chorizo and chicken. It was a generous portion and very very delicious. The waiters claim this is what they eat back home, but obviously take that with a grain of salt (no pun). The croquetas are rich, velvety and savory. Nice flecks of jamon serrano.   The Vaca Frita was somewhat average to me. It definitely sounded amazing and used two ingredients that I love together: beef and onions...then they fry it. The actual product was a little tougher than I would have liked and a little under seasoned - but I won't hold it against them.   All in all, if you've had really good Spanish/Tapas before, then you're probably not going to be too impressed here, though it will be enjoyable. For newcomers, this is a great place to start developing your tapas palate.  4/5

BhAWKEXbr7sGQrl1xqUQxA.text: Small, intimate spot. Cocktail menu is A+, (try the caipirinha) food was solid. Only criticism is that the service was a little on the slow side even when it was slower/less crowded. Place definitely picked up after work with a nice sophisticated crowd.

1BFuk4uPsYdXvi7DWJrsNQ.text: Reserved a table for 4 prior to a night out (movie night) and at first was worried about timing.  The dishes are all tapas for the most part and are obviously made to order and can take some time.  To my surprise they came out quick and the service was great.  We sat outside as it offers a bit better people watching being as it's in the alley/courtyard area of Hearst Tower.  The food was divine and I'll certainly be back.  Parking is tough so either street park or find a parking deck.  I don't believe they have valet here.

Dbo_bHXQZZ3GPqtYTfvUeQ.text: This spot is absolutely great! Delicious sangria, great wine, new beers, and amazing food. It's a small location and can get pretty lively/packed during evenings and weekends. Make sure you have a reservation if you plan to go during these times. Their wait staff is very attentive and happy to give recommendations. Share a few tapas dishes, you really can't go wrong with anything here. Without a doubt one of my favorite spots to eat and drink in Charlotte.

_IrS0e0Rw2AkUlSXXHWLaw.text: Nice decor, romantic lighting and friendly staff.  Menu is unique and full of tasty sounding items. The Tuna was my favorite tapas while the sauteed spinach had too much oil.  With some subtle changes my rating would be four stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuna carpaccio was delicious!

Fl9Nx6KYyA1fuJJjirGN8Q.text: Came here on Saturday evening with my husband and a friend. We had reservations for 8pm.   This place is soooo tiny but a great atmosphere in side! Our table wasn't ready yet, but they gave us complimentary glasses of sangria while we waited.   Once we sat down, we ordered the pitcher of sangria, which was about two glasses of sangria for each of us.   We decided to stick with all tapas for the night and ordered 6 different tapas (We ordered them two at a time so they came out in intervals). Probably could have done with only 5 because we were all crazy full at the end of it all. Note: you receive olive oil and dipping bread complimentary. -Croquettas- I read online that these were delish....didnt let us down! The order came with 3, so we each got one.....Though, arguably I could have eaten 20!!! Warm, ham-cheese-potato mix inside! These may have been the highlight of the night. -Pan de Tomate- The serving for this was 4 pieces of bread with a tomato spread on top. We probably could have skipped this....it was good but nothing amazing. -Stuffed Peppers- These were stuffed red peppers. Not sure what the filling inside was but I know it was in the vegetarian section of the menu. Very good and I recommend. There were 3 peppers. -Chorizo with onions- This was my friend and husband's favorite dish. Super caramalized onions with perfectly cooked slices of chorizo. Very good. There was plenty for the three of us. -Eggplant Bruschetta-  Very good.....super garlicy! There were either 3 or 4 of these....keep in mind I was 3 glasses of sangria in (plus the cosmo from earlier!!!)! -Clams in red sauce- Perfect end. The claims were cooked perfectly. We actually kept taking the bread from the table and dipping it in the sauce because it was that good. This portion size was very large for tapas.   Will absolutely return. Great food and good atmosphere. Just make a reservation because it isn't a large venue

MsA188SQMsrZ_S9sjWj_bA.text: What a fun and great find in downtown charlotte!  A delicious Spanish Tapa bar with authentic atmosphere and delicious food.  Great service and very professional, polite staff.   I thoroughly enjoyed the octopus and Spanish Omelette.

-yvkz3kItiTEpEsFlWH0Vw.text: I feel like this place could be a lot better. Came for lunch and got the scallops with cabbage, vegetables, and quinoa. The sides were fine but the scallops were okay (a bit rubbery). But for the price, I guess I can't complain. The lunch came with a baby green salad and sweet tea. Never got the sweet tea. I figured the baby green salad was the same salad on the regular menu also called baby green salad that had goat cheese, almonds, and tomatoes, but it wasn't. It was just lettuce and light dressing. Service was pretty slow around 1:00. We were the only table in there. The staff definitely outnumbered the guests. I think the manager ended up taking over since the server was M.I.A. May come again in hopes that the quality of the food and service improve.

_SvQ7THZ5U-pus1_gsPrpQ.text: Food was pretty good, so was service. Croquetas, churrasco and tuna tartare were delicious. The salmon carpaccio was good. The yucca was not that good (I'm not a huge yucca fan though). Overall good. If you want to eat well it will be a pricey evening, but worth it.

79C2w1573liAOs9M6osVug.text: I chose to dine at Malabar on our last night here in Charlotte. I trusted the reviews and decided to give this place a shot. First off, let me start by saying that the service is bare minimum and our waitress barely spoke english. The complimentary bread that was given to us was not warm and neither was it fresh. It honestly tasted like I was eating 5 day old baguette with olive oil. As we were browsing through the menu, we realized that the paella had some fine print to it ( a minimum order of 2 ), $18 dollars per pax. Why would you state that pricing on your menu if it is basically required to order 2 portions, and of the same flavor? It almost seems like a scheme trying to make you order the Paella for $36.   Since we were in the mood for some paella anyway, we decided to order 2 portions of the Paella de Pescado. Wow. I'm no paella connoisseur, but this was by far the worst paella I have ever had. The only thing I'll at least credit them for is the generosity of seafood. There were at least 8 clams, 8 mussels, 2 huge shrimps along with many other seafoods. However, the seafood wasn't fresh and all I tasted was literally the sea. The sangria that I ordered was fine but the presentation could be improved. A solid 3/5 stars for that. At the end of our meal, we were given a complimentary chocolate mousse cake. That was nice surprise but I was really expecting better food at a restaurant with such a great reputation. An absolute let down.

_hNy_ALXujJ42eHdzphucA.text: Good atmosphere, they have nice lunch specials. Decided to try the mojito, which was sub par. I had the soup of the day which was good and the seafood paella which was really good def recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Paella
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mojitos

b5yhmkwEYthU29aux7CdnA.text: We had a superb lunch here! The food was so so yummy! If I were you I would check out the tappas! Order some for the table and share! Service was a little slow and it gets packed right at noon, but definitely a great place to check out!

WctPy9rFtv3TFwFon172bw.text: Came here pretty late near closing time with a fairly large group and they were accommodating. I can't remember everything we ordered because we got so many dishes and just shared. They were all flavorful, fresh, and well made.   They offer a fair amount of vegetarian dishes too and one of my faves was this potato dish in a tomato marinate. Soooo good I can still taste it.   For dessert I ordered the flan, and I really looooove flan. This one was good but I've had better flan. Overall good food, good service but nothing too special in my opinion.

4smuO7M4BwH7cvD5Pu2IEA.text: Malabar ended up being one of the better meals I had on my trip to Charlotte.  +  Service.  Everyone was so friendly and helpful (menu suggestions, making sure the drinks were filled, plates were taken away, etc.) +  The Salad.  I had the chicken salad and it was spot on.  Fresh greens, perfectly cooked chicken and some tangy goat cheese.   +  The outdoor space was small, but it was shaded and comfortable even with it being in the mid 80's.

rtHdXFMAADt4cBmlc7X7bw.text: I came for the flan and stayed for the churrasco!  If you're a fan of flan, this is good as it gets. Freshly made, creamy, caramel syrup and even a cinnamon stick on top! $4!!!  The grilled skirt steak (churrasco) was very tender and tasty!  It comes with 2 sides.  $12!  Very pleasant atmosphere, and very attentive staff.

2VSkpXrM1Vc6LjcWuDQQHQ.text: Excellent tapas in the heart of Charlotte. Authentic Jamon Iberco. Just as good, if not better than the tapas in Sevilla.

O6P_KiHGOLAwqS1awSMvxQ.text: We went here for our date night and really enjoyed the food and atmosphere. The crispy beef and the croquetas are awesome. I would definitely recommend this place to friends and family.

ivi_Jn4kNgTzmAalXETWhw.text: The best Spanish food in Charlotte. The zarzuela is probably one of the top 5 entrees I've ever had. Great service, pleasant atmosphere. My wife and I love malabar. The paella is also very good as well. I've had the royal and pescado. Another can't miss is the churrasco. Grilled skirt steak w potatoes and chimichurri. Always cooked to perfection as well. We always recommend malabar to our family and anyone going uptown for a date night or just a good time.

h6zBByROrKOqGuQJXLMSSA.text: I really wanted to like Malabar more. I've had my eye on the place since it opened (I used to love Coco Osteria), but I never managed to make it there til Saturday night. The fella and I decided to go for dinner and made reservations for 6:30. As others have noted, it's a pretty small place, so reservations are highly recommended.  I usually don't like such cramped quarters because I feel like everyone around me is listening to my conversation, but at Malabar, the music and people are so lively that I didn't mind at all. Our service was impeccable.  So, why only 3 stars? The food. Sigh. We made it a night of tapas and tried the croquetas (ham, potato), albondigas (beet meatballs in tomato sauce), vaca frita (crispy beef with pickled onion on top), and romesco (eggplant bruschetta). While it was all fine, it was all just fine. Nothing stood out, nothing had much spice... it was all just, well, fine. I had hoped that out of four tapas, surely one of them would be delicious! But no. I also got the sangria after reading other reviews of how good it was; it was good, but can you really mess up sangria OR make it super great? It was fine, too.  We did try the tres leches cake for dessert (after asking out waitress to pick between that and the churros), and it was good - small but the perfect size for not gorging, moist, and creamy.  Thankfully, the atmosphere and service made up for the food, but I don't think we'll make it a point to stop by Malabar again.

Nqx0qrFFEEutwLtZmvhZ3Q.text: Excellent tapas in Uptown. Came here with coworkers and ordered a bunch of food. The paella was great but needed some heat. I loved the potatoes, octopus, sliced beef was my favorite. Will definitely come back.

o5ZpvLe_GQcwS4j8ZQ0CrQ.text: Went here for a date night recently and was really happy with just about everything. We ordered albondigas, patatas bravas, pulpo, serano jamon, and churrasco. Everything was delicious and beautifully plated. Drink selection was well priced. I did feel the tapas were rather pricey but I'm assuming they use quality products to create their dishes so I can live with it. I also loved the atmosphere. We'll definitely be back!

YZ_VRAzdlNTTGrVZ9jDT8Q.text: Malabar is an excellent tapas restaurant !  We are from out of town and someone at a comedy club and recommended it.  Boy were we glad.  We had to wait a little while for our paella but it was well worth the wait.  Honestly it was the best paella I've ever had! And the sangria is to die for!  Rice pancake app with manchego cheese was amazing but the canelones were lackluster.  Will def be back next visit.

04mRRjlL4PG3kmQNCmYNVA.text: Great food and great service! Went here with my family and friends during a winter trip and could not have been more pleased. All the food was great. Will definitely go back the next time I am in Charlotte.

ysPxbjsQc-CdIlKzDrJkCQ.text: The worst possible service I had ever gotten. The waiter was simply angry, slamming drinks on our table, not paying attention to our requests and responding to our questions with hostility. We were scared to ask for the check! That's no way to greet people from out of town. No matter how good the food would have been (and it was mediocre),  STAY AWAY!

wQ4uu24pIXcbYjP0pq3M0w.text: Great salads- I especially like their Salmon salad and I also love their coffee. Good location and very nice eating outside during summer time.

iK54udIY_PyE8UlFGxW8og.text: I wouldn't go back for their mediocre food. We got 9 different tapas - gambas, empanadas, mussels, artichokes, meatballs, calamari, octopus, crispy steak and stuffed peppers. It was all rather bland and certainly not authentic Spanish food. The service and atmosphere was decent. But the food was certainly forgettable.

LG4iN2qN5xZton0SynXaSg.text: Simple, friendly and good service....Think tapas, tequila and conversation.

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tequila, Manchego, Chorizo Seco, Yuca Frita

libatNWE_MLy6j44QS4L_g.text: Food is ok. DO NOT SIT OUTSIDE!!! Aggressive bums will hassle you for money while you're eating. The employees watch while this is happening and hide inside because they're too scared to come out and say anything. Hey management... turns out it's your job to go out and tell the bums not to hassle the patrons or you will call the police.

gS8dyvlSQdbObDKxdASC7Q.text: The food was really good and came out within a decent amount of time. The Patatas Bravas was good but lacking, it was like regularly prepared potatoes but with a sauce on the side. I'm no expert but i had this very dish in DC and it was over the top amazing. Chicken Canelones was good but not very much chicken. The mussels are awesome and worth trying. Just get some sangria and any of it will go down fine. My biggest issue was that the waiter added a few bucks to his tip after the fact and i had to call and get that taken care of, not my favorite thing to do.

OpF-COuhEnvit4Rw1dzFtQ.text: The seafood soup with tomato base was amazing (can't remember the name right now but I've had the same dish elsewhere). The rest was blah....not bad but not very good except the fried Yucca was so dry we couldn't eat them. The chicken cannelloni was decent, the beef empanadas were below average (the beef was dry as a bone with no flavor), the veggie ones were pretty good. Nice location and ambiance. Service was good and the food was nice and hot when it hit the table.

pOwexDN-m3fcdWhuKAVQsw.text: Lovely spot for tapas/sangria, white sangria was very good.  Favorite's:  -Spanish tortilla - Serrano Ham and Machengo - Chicken Shells with sauce  - White Sangria  Non Favorite's: Lack of parking/valet Not really sexy environment, very small space, there were lots of families with kids when we were there

3SitLgXRnomTkLLTAPGuqQ.text: Mediocre food. I got the shrimp and it wasn't cleaned properly and still had the intestines down the back. Pricey for what you get.

a3-NF1PDvu6MvUiDoNrg9g.text: Fantastic dinner. Great service, atmosphere  and the food was delicious. Can't wait to go back. Nicely done.

gJG0VuJX1LT8q-pa5M2gig.text: Nothing was overly impressive. Ate at this spot before it was malabar and the interior/set up was very similar (granted its SMALL so not much you can really do). There are a lot of tables packed into the space so you cant help but listen to everybodies conversations. The food was ok, nothing was memorable enough for me to want to go back. The croquettes were good, meatballs too smokey, vaca frita overcooked and dry (thou pickled onions were excellent), we had a chicken/articoke dish in bechemel sauce that was not heated all the way thru.. for dessert tres leches which in my opinion was angel food cake based which overwhelmed the rest of the flavors. I think I had set my expections to high for this place and it came up short.

qANdF2iZ-cE5NVA_C1nHlQ.text: This was an amazing experience! The owner/manager was awesome! Each item that we tried was delicious. My favorites were the crispy beef with pickled onions and the stuffed peppers. You must try the sangria...absolutely delicious. We ordered two pitchers!. Oh wait,do not leave without ordering tres leches you will not be disappointed. A great dining experience!

tzmZgrMOxevyuIdWTOVp7A.text: This was such a fun find. For date night, a low-key happy hour or pre-show nibble, this Uptown newcomer is choice.   The dinner menu includes a nice selection of meat-, veggie- and fish-based tapas dishes, as well as paella (allow ~30 minutes for these gems) and desserts (hello, tres leches cake). I've found that three to five dishes comprise a filling meal for two. The croquetas, pimientos rellenos and tortilla de esparragos have been standouts for me, and the seafood paella beckons for when I return. The list of Spanish wines has a good number of by-the-glass options, with some bottle options being reasonably priced. Specialty cocktails also are for the sipping. (Caipirinha? Siiii.)  On each of my visits I've been greeted warmly at the door by the host/manager and seated in the cozy-chic, low-lit dining room. Patio seating is great when the weather cooperates. The staff is friendly and super-quick in my experience. On one visit we let our server take the wheel and select our dishes; we weren't disappointed. Glad to have Malabar among our options for a unique meal.

I1qT4fZhmZQA2px7vb9vjA.text: Service as very good contrary to the other reviews I read. The food was excellent. Great flavors. The bread shared before the meal was disappointing. Expected something a little different and with more variety. But I highly recommend Malabar.

PqHV2fNcsFgrHQkOMiY53A.text: Excellent choice for lunch. Had the Milanese Chicken sandwhich on Ciabatta bread, with an avocodo and chipotle mayo sauce. Delicious. Loved their spicy potatoes and this delectible creamy/spicy aioli dip. With water all under $10! Pretty good deal for an excellent Uptown lunch!

tes8989tBs63Io-5y2Iw0A.text: Bring back Coco!!  A friend picked this place for his birthday dinner last week.  It was a Monday so it was pretty dead.  My other friend got there 1st and got us a table, i walked inside to let them know my reservation name.  Everyone was sitting at the bar and turned and looked at me like I disturbed them.  Before I got there my friend ordered me a cosmo, took a while to get there for only have 3 customers.  It tasted okay so that is the 2 stars.  My friends sangria was disgusting and was spiced with something awful, they did not charge us for it.  He then went to look over the wine list, as the manager just stood there and stared at him waiting for his reply.  Super uncomfortable, it wasn't like we were in a rush!  We ordered the cod fritters and 2 cheeses to start.  I didn't care for any of it, the presentation was bad and the flavor was worse.  We figured we were in for a night of disappointments if we stayed, so we opted to pay the check and head somewhere else.  I was really hoping for some great Spanish tapas since they are few and far between here.  But it just was bad and awkward and made me question how the same people who own and run Luce could possibly be involved with this place.

WWUaLN5ol7fkajOKikoahw.text: This place kills it in every category. The food was succulent, the atmosphere was enticing, and the service was excellent. For such a small place they were easily able to seat my party of 9 promptly.

1FJ0874jJDsGwNiYcBeJTQ.text: What really saves this place is the food. It is a tiny place, so I strongly suggest reservations for a weekend night. My water was kept full all night by the bus lady, but the server rarely checked on us. The atmosphere is fun and lively. It would make a great girls' night out or date night spot. Again, the food is delicious but the waitstaff seemed overworked and poorly trained.

Yi4AWL0NH3qviGHxLNyr8g.text: Personalized service, romantic atmosphere w friends or a date.   I loved the food. Croquettas, flank steak, spanish wines.... ahhhh refreshing for Charlotte.   The manager and staff were all so sweet (and hot). I will def go here again!!  Oh and you can not go wrong with the prices!

-FmUh6jUxyJ-JFvP_OwaYA.text: They have the worst service. I wanted to use their restroom, so I offered to buy a drink. They literally refused to serve me, regardless of the fact that I wanted to spend money at their restaurant. I will never spend money there again.

EaazD5RRs7qpNEvhUmwcmg.text: Wife and I popped in here for dinner with another couple on a recent trip to Charlotte.  We're big fans of tapas so we couldn't resist checking out this spot just a few blocks from our Uptown hotel.  Had a reservation, so we were seated promptly upon arrival.  The space is small but cozy and well appointed.  It can be a tight squeeze with the servers moving around, but we weren't bothered by it, as we were situated in a corner.  We ordered up everything at once for our table, sharing a cheese plate, cured meat board, Canelones, Empanadas, Patatas Bravas, and then finishing off with a meat paella.  On the whole, we found the food to be good, but not great.  Didn't care for the presentation of the patatas bravas, with the sauces served on the side rather than being integrated into the dish.  The rest of the dishes were fine, but without the depth of flavor I've come to expect at other Spanish tapas spots I've visited.  Service was marginal at best.  Our server provided pretty curt responses to our inquiries about the menu; it almost seemed like we were somewhat of an inconvenience by coming out for dinner that evening.  I was particularly disappointed in the staff's inability to explain more about the dishes we ordered, especially when it came to the meat and cheese plates.  The staff was unable to give us any insights on the cheeses or meats, such as where they came from and the flavor characteristics of the cheese.  We ordered some churros for dessert, which took nearly 25 minutes to arrive at the table, leading me to believe that our order was forgotten somewhere along the way.  The tapas game in Charlotte is not strong, so Malabar may satisfy your cravings if you're jonesing for a few traditional Spanish dishes.  However, should another Spanish tapas spot open up, I feel like the competition would be pretty stiff without having to try too hard.

l7krXxNKTfM6tOV6oH2UMQ.text: We just stopped here while strolling in uptown charlotte one evening.. The atmosphere was quiet and serene. The food lacked flavor. All the 3 dishes wert too bland. For the price and choices around malabar, this is probably worthy of 1 star.

KoF5g3FuP_qD7YKD-xJp3g.text: We dined on a Friday night, tried Malabar during restaurant week for something new. Definitely a huge disappointment ! Took and incredible amount of time to get drinks and appetizers (30 plus minutes for apps ) . Appetizer were delicious ( tried 6 different things at table, all were great).  But nothing came out to the right person which is noted in another review also.  Dinner took another 45 minutes after this to come out- horrible . Ordered the skirt steak....extremely fatty and un enjoyable . I pushed this aside it was so bad.   To make matters worse it was another 25 minutes after we had to remind our server of desserts. I was ready to just forget the dessert and get my check. The checkout was a disaster.   Two wrong charges posted to my debit card the following day which totaled almost 400 dollars of WRONG charges. This is on top of drinks that were not mine being incorrectly added to my bill. What a nightmare to resolve....when I attempted to resolve I was told that they would " do me a favor this time" and refund the alcohol charges for the drinks that were incorrectly added. I don't even drink alcohol, only had water during this visit. Still waiting for the money to be returned as of 48 hrs later and multiple follow ups with restaurant.   This is the worst experience I have ever had in a restaurant  and its a shame because the place looks like it could be great ( nice location, nice ambiance, unique menu) .  Would never return

H8p4rRNm1ZdMBZfOi077_A.text: I have wanted to try this restaurant many times but never pulled the trigger until I saw the opportunity to make a reservation through Yelp. A couple of clicks and I had a table for 2 reserved for Tuesday, July 5th at 7:45pm. Arrived at 7:35pm and greeted with a sign in the window that said the restaurant was closed on July 5th and to visit their sister restaurant. Not that we went hungry given the choices downtown Charlotte, but missed the opportunity to get a reservation at another restaurant we were going to try.  Not sure whether the blame here lies with Malabar or Yelp, but I presume with an electronic reservation system you can indicate days on which the restaurant is closed.

2Am3Bp30UoV8UsaM6KwEtQ.text: Had high hopes, but disappointed. Expensive for portions they served.  For example, Crispy beef, $16.95, we were served 6 small pieces of beef. Tiny small. On a white dinner plate, no garnishment, just the beef with nothing.  Presentation was a zero, and it was not seasoned, just tasted like fried meat. Could have been skirt steak or any cut of beef, tasted blah. Had Pulpo, served sliced into pieces, no tentacles, again not what one expects at a tapas place.   We also ordered Gambas. Supposed to be grilled shrimp, like the ones with tails on them. We got a bowl if the tiny bay shrimp which in a grocery store is $1.99 a pound. Never in a million years would any Tapas restaurant served these as Gambas. $15 for that dish!  Spent  $100, left hungry. We do Tapas all over including Barcelona (visiting from out of town here in CLT) this was not a great experience.

4_880fmZDIPcN3g6WqkjuQ.text: I love Malabar. Great atmosphere, wine, and reasonable prices. It reminds me of home where together with friends would spend hours sipping wine and eating great food. If more places like this where out there, I would not have to travel to Europe or Canada for a nice meal!

UHLfRQx4_G_G73nfTSpOYw.text: The Tapas were pretty good, the Sangria was awesome. Some of the best I've ever had. I sat alone at the bar because I was traveling on business but the atmosphere in the dining room had a good vibe and everyone looked and sounded like they were enjoying themselves. The service was just OK. I sit at the bar when I am alone so that I can hopefully have a conversation with someone, like the bartender, but everyone who worked there was huddling in the corner chatting with each other when they weren't taking care of their customers. It's a small place so it was pretty obvious this was the case. If not for this I would have given them 4 starts.

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States

XOTcLJXkiHHGhMYf2nJR_g.text: We went to Malabar last night before the Charlotte Symphony Orchestra show and it was my first time there. The atmosphere is great with a small space and everybody in the same room. It's great use of the space and you can see what other tables are getting as you prepare for your next possible dish. The service was great and our questions were answered with accurate descriptions of the food. The stuffed peppers were delicious and I can't wait to go again so I can try the paella and something from their wine list.

wD01YfH2PJtAQahGnwaQyw.text: Incredible place to enjoy Spanish food. I like the sangria is unique, the chicmichurry very tasty, the dinner was excellent. Very good service, I recommend to spend a nice and very romantic dinner.

tQqtSN_f9j9WzeEY9ocgoA.text: Malabar is a tremendous let down for anyone who has experienced good service. The menu is interesting enough and the food perfectly acceptable, but my companion and I never said "this is good" more than once and certainly will not be adding the restaurant to our regular list.   I made a reservation via Yelp for New Year's Eve. We were seated promptly but waited for 15 minutes or more before -- long enough that we began looking for a server -- as no one indicated that he or she was our server or had even come to take our drink orders. As some others have indicated our bread tasted stale instead of appropriately chewy and crunchy. Once I finally made eye contact with a man behind the bar, he came over and seemed nervous rather than welcoming. I ordered a half carafe of wine, and since we had been waiting so long indicated we wanted to order our meal as well. There was no apology for the delay, and the server seemed disinterested in providing any real service other than jotting down our six tapas. I stated that the orders could be brought out as the kitchen recommended.   Each dish arrived in sets of twos. They were placed on the table with no words, no inquiry as to how we were enjoying the meal and if we needed anything else. Again the food was good -- not great -- which made me sad because I had wanted a lovely experience for my companion who hasn't had the joy of eating at some of the amazing places I have. How I wish I'd chosen somewhere else!   We ordered flan and tres leches for dessert. The presentation on the tres leches was tacky -- a bowl with a canned spiral of whipped cream and a cherry.   The check was settled quickly, and I felt remiss to even leave a tip.   I imagine Malabar stays open due to its location and reasonable prices, but it is hardly a dining destination.

yOTmFirjpKO6Ou7Gbnr4vA.text: The food is pretty amazing here. I stumbled into this place by accident but am very glad of my finding and was super pleased with my order.  I had an octopus dish and the lamb chop dish. They was very delightful, especially the octopus dish. The soft texture and was very flavorful. Portions were rather small like most Spanish dishes, but it worked well for me as I was not looking to stuff myself.

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gorgeous lamb chops!

6Bf1v96oOHWVoO_f8R48fQ.text: Waited almost 45 min at the door with only one other couple standing in front of us without even being acknowledged. There isn't a True waiting area except for the entry way and as people started to come in behind us we had truly no where to go. Not even really sure if this place even has a host... Eventually we caught the attention of who I think may have been a bartender/waiter/possibly host to let him know we were waiting for a table and is if we were bothering him told us someone would eventually get to us. At this point the 2 couples who had walked in after us said "there's tons of restaurant's around here let's find another one!" and literally walked out. Having driven around for almost 30 min looking for one on the other side and having already waited almost 1/2 an hour on a day when most businesses had closed to show solidarity for Immigrant workers. I'm not going to lie I was starving and feeling kind of vested to see this experience through. The place was extremely crowded but eventually we were seated. We had croquetas, mussels, the stuffed ravioli and eggs with ham & fries which were super tasty. Price point was fairly inexpensive with nothing over $20 on the menu. Quite honestly I would have given this place 5 stars had the customer service not been lacking so. Wish everyone knew you only get one chance to make a first impression.

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States

ErOgI3h5g0iGnKIdIomIGA.text: First time at Malabar and the service was great. Our tapas were delicious. And the drinks were even better. The server explained how the menu worked and it made it easy for us to make a decision. Great place to have family dinner and conversation while sampling different foods. The server was kind enough to gives us a complimentary tres leches on the house. I would definitely recommend this place and because of the great service I would go back! Oh and I definitely recommend trying the coconut mojito!! It's amazing

2GisWjGnbeFqhqTHhDSVbw.text: We came here on a Friday evening and were pretty disappointed in the food. Spanish cuisine is our absolute favorite and we had high hopes and expectations for this restaurant. However, they were not met and the three stars I'm giving are for the good service. To start, my sangria was very watered down. Not a big issue, but at $8 a glass, they could've put a little more wine and less ice.  For tapas, we ordered the stuffed peppers, shrimp, churrasco, and empanadas. The stuffed peppers were decent and the churrasco was tender and delicious. However, the remaining plates were not up to standard. The shrimp we were served were tiny and tasted incredibly fishy. Definitely not fresh. I've had this specific plate in various other Spanish restaurants and was really excited when I ordered it. We ended up leaving the entire plate practically untouched, in fear of food poisoning. As for the empanadas, the pastry was crisp and yummy but the filling ruined the dish. The meat was way too sweet and it left a bad aftertaste. We honestly could have overlooked the two downright horrible tapas plates if it weren't for the disappointing desserts that followed. I ordered churros and my boyfriend ordered the creme catalan. My churros arrived cold, and the chocolate sauce  they were served with was goopy. This made it impossible to dip the churros into the chocolate. I had to practically scoop it up with a fork. My boyfriend's creme catalan was mediocre and lacked flavor (We've actually visited this restaurant once prior for desserts and coffee and had a much better experience, so it's possible that this time was just a bad night for them). Also, the espresso machine was broken, so we were only able to order regular coffee. A cappuccino certainly would have put me in a better mood!  Overall, although the service was good and the ambience was romantic, the food failed to impress. We paid $130 and left hungry and unsatisfied so we probably won't be coming here again, at least anytime soon.

9G5PgF13KopNXphWLfCBvA.text: Been twice - you need to know what to order. Avoid bacon wrapped dates. Spanish dishes are great. Pan con tomate awesome. As is Jamon Serrano and stuffed peppers. We'll be back!

DZU03WB6MHNoSUZ3Z40Xeg.text: * 1.5  Worst restaurant I've been to in a long time. The mussels tasted like they've been sitting in their filth for over a week. The highlight of the meal were the lamb chops, and that was only because they were edible. Of the four dishes we ordered, they only brought three. Mussels were spoiled. Stuffed peppers were bland. Lamb chops were fine, but for $6 a chop, I expect better than fine. To boot they brought the wrong drink and insisted it was what I ordered (notwithstanding the absence of cayenne pepper).   Don't go. There are plenty of restaurants uptown with good food.

kHGCYKHZSo5umMBQdxmzXQ.text: Our final night in Charlotte for this work trip & a coworker had selected Malabar for our team dinner  We started w/ this awesome wine called something like GR-74.....it was a cab blend & perfectly delightful  Ordered a variety of tapas as well as 2 paellas (Veggie & Royal) & we had an abundance of food!  The tapas included the fried potatoes which were crispy on the outside & mushy on the inside - utter potato perfection!  Stuffed Chile Relleno w/ pimento cheese - stuffed w/ a mix that was more rice than cheese, we still liked the "deconstructed" pimento cheese just fine.  Also got the veggie empanadas & a couple of chicken dishes that the team enjoyed  The Paellas were both yummy - I of course only can speak for the veggie which had corn, carrots, artichoke hearts, peas & peppers - lots & lots of rice  The Royal seemed to be stocked to the brim w/ seafood, short-ribs & other meaty delights - the team liked it a lot  In fact, they liked both paellas a lot & the dinner was hugely fun, there was a good crowd in there, even for our late arrival.....and we got to leave w/ leftovers for the locals of the group.  Huge fans!

d1eCJF7U7E1VOTIhzoOuHw.text: I ate dinner here during Restaurant week.  The experience was great.  Their beer prices are quite reasonable.  I was expecting $6 or $7 per bottle like similar restaurants.  I threw back a couple of the Brazilian beers and then switched to Sangria to be a little more in the Spanish mood.  I started with the mussels.  I had a ton of mussels in Belgium so I was excited to give Spanish mussels a try.  They were great.  I had the chicken as my main dish pretty much because everyone else got the steak with chimichurri and I wanted to have something to barter.  Both the steak and chicken were good.  For dessert my group made an even split between tres leches and the chocolate mousse.  Both were excellent.  The service was right on the whole evening clearing plates promptly and keeping our beverages refreshed.    The restaurant is quite small so I would strongly suggest having a reservation.  I did not see the normal menu, just the RW week menu so I'm not sure how prices normally are, but I would definitely go back during the normal time.

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tres leches

_QVpQZNAZIyYm31sGfjAIQ.text: Tres leches was good here. Paella was decent. Stuffed peppers and omlette were ok. Overall decent places to try small plates.

9afuFhq99XPPgg1SCm8PUA.text: I ventured to this cozy little establishment to meet a visiting friend for a catch up dinner. As per usual I was chronically early for our 7pm reservation but the host was kind enough to seat me at one of the many open tables early. He even asked if I had a preference, which was an appreciated touch.   During my wait for my friend someone came to fill our water glasses and ordered a glass of wine (sorry folks no Wednesday night drink specials - which surprised me). I did not see my usual pinot noir on the menu so I selected a syrah which was a decent substitution.   When my friend arrived and we were ready to order we selected Pimientos Rellenos (stuffed roasted peppers) and Pulpo (octopus) to share and she also got a salad. Both were delicious and hearty enough that I felt full just splitting the two options. They also brought bread which was okay. The bread was the only strange part of the experience - they waited until my dining companion arrived to serve it even though it didn't come out warm. I would have appreciated the snack while I reviewed the menu but perhaps they only give out one per table and didn't want me to hog it all before my companion arrived?  This quiet intimate restaurant looks like a great place for date night and I will happily return to try more of their menu.

6WulAbEaCmH0nlNeLvCL-Q.text: Spanish Tapas and Treats!  There was a 30 minute wait when we arrived with no reservation, but we sat at the little bar and had coconut mojitos and chatted - no worries... then we were seated on time at a nice table. What i love about this location is that you are in Uptown and you can see Uptown - you can people watch and enjoy the city atmosphere from inside.  I have reviewed this place for lunch and gave it 4 stars - now i am reviewing it for dinner and its up to 5. I really love this little spot (and yes, it is little). It's so cozy though. The entire staff is very Spanish and they play Spanish music and have amazing Spanish Tapas...  I love the patatas bravas, Croquetas, Churrasco, the meat platter oh and my favorite from lunch is the same at dinner Gambas al Ajo. (Garlicy Shrimp )  Really good cappuccinos for after dinner, a great coconut mojito for pre-dinner and really yummy flan and empanadas... YUM YUM YUM...  How do you say YUM in Spanish???

7AJiD9iB8jzQg0NMaXkZhw.text: Spanish tapas are probably one of my favorite cuisines (behind Indian).  I enjoyed my visit here--the patatas bravas, which I've had at another place, were very good.  The spinach with pine nuts and golden raisins was also tasty.  The atmosphere is quite nice; just put on a nice pair of jeans and button-down shirt and enjoy a nice evening.  I also think they do 1/2 priced bottles of wine on some nights--can't beat that!!!!!

_8hbnDsU_APdB9xr22ptgQ.text: This place is good for lunch. If you don't care about prices, you will fine. The way they serve tapas is amazing. But that's it. About bar, is complicate,but theirs wine cart is pretty nice. The service is poor, just one waiter/bartender knows what's going on))) The biggest problem was parking. And I think they need to fix it. The interior is simple and they have a small patio. If you have lunch and anymore, you can go there.

IRmc9XtOtyIjBQteGmqAOA.text: This used to be my absolute favorite restaurant in CLT since 2013. I am not sure if there is new management, a new chef or just a menu change, but the restaurant is no longer the Malabar we knew and loved. The menu is a major departure from traditional Spanish food. The tapas were extremely bland or incorrectly seasoned based on the dish. The patatas bravas are now just French fries- very floral seasoned ones at that. Very disappointing experience.

0nJwwH1VPt8Xi7buHUOMbA.text: Im never disappointed with the small plates & sangria here! I love the asparagus & mushrooms with romesco sauce (seriously, I could lick the plate clean), the mashed potato dish is divine, papas bravas are seasoned nicely, the olives are soooooooo good, and the risotto stuffed peppers are great too! A great place for an intimate dinner or just cocktails & apps :). Service is always wonderful too.

m0gbHjYVZP5BT7yfSK_AyQ.text: Delicious food. Came here for lunch and really enjoyed it. The menu is limited but it's worth it. The side salad and fried yuca were amazing as was the sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States

F6XE6QCuNMC3bpnxKxCiXg.text: The food here is amazing! Our favorite must gets are:  1. Crispy Beef. The pickled red onions complemented it so well!  2. Coconut Mojito  3. Red Sangria

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coconut Mojito
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coconut Flan

Zp_pNDLJIIBGqg9VmuZI3Q.text: Malabar needs to define what kind of restaurant it wants to be. Is it a Tapas (Spain) bar, is it Mexican (Oaxaca cheese, quesadillas, etc) or is it Latin (Cuban sandwich). My suggestion be a Spanish Restaurant for lunch as well as dinner. Get rid of the non-spanish items. You are not very good at them anyway.

XbKGM6y6Ek022pC1zCXNew.text: In a time when everyone is either doing "tapas inspired" or small plates, its hard to find more traditional, authentic spanish tapas. The few times I have come to Malabar, I get distracted with the bread, they have a great balsamic and oil. The sangria is delicious and still day dream about it. The paella the two times I had it, was sadly inconsistent but it would not keep me from going again and ordering it again. The service both times were pleasant. Definitely returning and would recommend.

Sul0n6HcjjlBm2uO_YRAYA.text: My visit for restaurant week felt like cafeteria food. Gulp.  I've wanted to visit Malabar for years and have heard nothing but positives. We dined recently with another couple and after waiting a few minutes for our table were welcomed with water/ bread with olive oil. While the menu sounded delicious the food came out super quickly - dessert before my husband had finished his entree for example.  We loved our visit to Curate in Asheville, and this meal couldn't have been more different.   Nothing was stand out good or bad. Everything felt like it was pre-portioned (a little small) and waiting for the next restaurant week guest to order. I like to use restaurant week to find new favorite spots for our dining out rotation and Malabar didn't pass this litmus test. So many places do restaurant week well and if you aren't interested in providing the same level of quality during this time, then opt out.

qxFwIQsaXrdhry-noHOtEA.text: We had a wonderful experience at Malabar.  We decided to visit Malabar before heading next door to the Blumenthal.  It's literally a 2-minute walk to the Blumenthal entrance.  We arrived at 6:15 pm for a 6:15 pm reservation.  There were two other 6:15 reservations ahead of us, and we ended up waiting about 20 minutes to be seated.  No worries, it was a Saturday night, and the place was really busy.  The place is small and intimate.  It is well decorated, cozy.  The tables are kind of close to one another, but I think it adds to the experience making it a nice, social atmosphere.  Great for tapas-style eating.  Upon being seated, we were greeted quickly and placed drink orders.  The wine was served quickly and we placed our initial food order a few minutes later.  We started with the croquetas, stuffed peppers, and artichokes with lemon.  They were all wonderful, but the croquetas were out of this world.  They came out warm, crisp and stuffed with ham and cheese.  We wound up ordering two more later in the meal.  The stuffed peppers were really nice.  I could take or leave the artichokes, but they were nicely prepared.  I'm not a huge artichoke lover, but wanted to try them so we weren't just ordering meats.  The second round of ordering, we had steak empanadas, vegetable and chicken kabobs, more croquetas, and a potato omelet.  The empanadas were excellent.  The crust was flaky and the carnitas inside were perfectly seasoned and tender.  The potato omelet was also great; light and fluffy eggs with tender potatos.  It was very filling.  The veggie and chicken kabobs were nice, with the grilled chicken having the best flavor.  We were ready for the check when we were surprised with the coconut gelato given to us on the house.  It was so delicious!  The coconut flavor was the perfect ending to our meal at Malabars.

4p3gR2BeNb1NXdfxJ9TVRw.text: I have been to Malabar on a few different occasions and the three star rating is an average of the 4 and 2 star visits that I've had.   The food is generally fine and the menu akin to traditional tapas. The meat dishes have generally been enjoyable and I do like the variety of dishes and specials on their menu. However, I would not recommend the mussels at all, they did not taste fresh and were definitely veering towards questionable territory. The meatballs have also been fairly bland and lukewarm. The kicker in our last experience was dessert. This was the first dessert I had ordered at Malabar and we went with one tres leches for three people. We didn't finish it and the tres leches enthusiast at the table sincerely thought that we had been served the wrong dish initially. We truly wanted to send it back, but didn't want to seem difficult or have an extended conversation about it so we settled for finishing the coffee and paying.   That being said, the ambiance is rather fun. The close together tables and hectic tapas atmosphere lead to a buzzy feeling when Malabar is full. Staff have always been helpful and courteous. I am hoping to give Malabar another chance, but will not be doing so with out of town guests.

ze5nf4L4_duiQD6qEgZkJw.text: There's not much I can say about this place that has an already been set, but if you're looking for a warm, intimate atmosphere with great interesting food and a nice selection of European beers and wine, this is your place!  The beef empanadas were fantastic! Very very flavorful! The clams were so-so. I definitely enjoyed the spinach, which had a very unique flavor, and you must cap off your dinner with a dessert. I had the Crema Catalina (I think that was what it is called) which was very similar to a creme brulee but with the cinnamon taste.  The staff was wonderful, with many of them coming from Europe which lends to an authenticity most Tapas places don't. I wish this place were in my town!

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great location in Uptown. This small, intimate, hip restaurant and bar is great!

-C90UgYwiO4tkqM3l8ufHg.text: We wanted something close to the theatre hall. We wanted small bites, interesting flavors.....we got it at Malabar !! We also got excellent service, great sipping Sangria and complimentary parking in the Hearst Tower. Ken the manager got us a seating, took care of us along with his staff and because of all this....a 5 star !!!   we will be back....thank you.....

qpgYiyKHr70dcNMh5voxqA.text: Ate here last night and the food was good but our waiter was not! I believe his name was Mike. He walked away while we were talking to him several times. He acted like he was irritated by our presence and did not want to be bothered. The table behind us was also his table and he spent time explaining the menu and answering their questions. Overwhelmingly different than the service we received. Since our party was over six people he automatically received a 20% tip. 20% times 8 people for disrespectful, terrible service. If Mike is your waiter when you go to Malabar ask for another!

JnlRSYb7tnHlc9QuSuHwVQ.text: While I really enjoyed the food (thus the 2 stars) our experience with our waiter Mike was one of the worse I've had. He did not seem pleased to serve my friends and I, often leaving the table before we could even complete our orders. As we observed other guests coming in, he treated them in a manner that was in complete contrast to our treatment. If the service in a restaurant cannot be consistent and pleasant, treating any guest that walks in with dignity and respect; it isn't a place I can recommend nor return to. I am hoping that Augusto the owner takes notice of this inappropriate behavior and addresses it.

78IaK7iU3iA2wx5JShD9LA.text: Just had dinner here with my girlfriends. The food was good but our server Mike was horrible. I guess he couldn't hide that he did not want to serve us because he gave us the bare minimum service. It was very noticeable and he was not helpful or engaging to us like he was with the other guests tables he was serving. I probably will not be returning especially if I know I will be treated that way.

R0AhFkxrSQiWs8GawpZG6Q.text: Food is amazing, if you love Spanish food then it's a must! Great service and a ton of options to choose from.  Never have had a bad meal and have always left satisfied!

-dUXSHB8B2ltOZnL-E0ouA.text: We had excellent service, interesting choices, tasty plates. We enjoyed our evening very much. Great wine suggestions!  We will come back!

G0AIZ0m7FbkJ1u_w0XkzeQ.text: I went here for a birthday celebration, and I was pretty underwhelmed by the whole experience. The service was extremely slow despite having a reservation. There were several large parties at the restaurant and they seemed to be sucking the wait and cook staff away from attending to us. It took at least 10 minutes for someone to take a drink order, although the support staff filled our water very regularly and were easily the most attentive staff there.  Beyond the service, the Spanish tapas were disappointingly mediocre. Having lived in Spain previously, I was really hoping to find a high quality tapas restaurant in Charlotte and thought the food was very average and definitely overpriced. The pimientos rellenos were the only truly outstanding dish out of the twelve we tried. The classic tapas like croquetas and patatas bravas were fine but nothing great. DO NOT order the espinaca catalana - very disappointing.  I will say that my group of six each ordered two tapas and had plenty of food to go around. I enjoy the sharing style and it worked well at Malabar. We were all quite full at the end, I just did not feel like the quality matched the price here.

l70pEdg0BtoO_UVdBlI8SQ.text: Malabar is a great option for dining in downtown Charlotte.  We all hear the word "tapas" thrown around these days to pretty much describe any place that features small plates.  But Malabar truly offers tapas, True Spanish tapas.    I tried to make a reservation for Malabar online but there were absolutely no reservations open for my planned Saturday night dinner.  However I called Malabar and had no problems making a 7pm reservation.    The restaurant was very full and running on a wait but we were greeted warmly and immediately.  We were seated very soon after our reservation time.    For a cocktail I tried their red sangria which was very good.  They also have a white sangria option.  For tapas, my friend and I ordered several different tapas.  Our favorite tapas were the Pulpo (octopus) and the vegetarian Pimientos Rellenos.  The only thing we tried that truly disappointed us was the flan.  I have had flan many times and it is one of my favorite desserts.  But our flan was almost inedible.  The sauce was very bitter and the custard didn't have the firm yet creamy texture it should.  I'm guessing it was a fluke and hopefully they usually have a good flan.    The restaurant itself is gorgeous.  It's a small space but with a very tall ceiling featuring a large modern chandelier, it feels spacious and elegant.  We had a little confusion with who was our server.  It never felt like we had a dedicated person and everyone appeared kind of in the weeds so it was hard to know who to ask when we wanted to order more tapas, get our bill, et cetera.  Everything on the menu looks amazing.  We were oohing and ahhing at our neighbors' food.  One table had the paella for two and another had empanadas that looked equally delicious.  l will definitely be back to Malabar and look forward to trying more of the tapas and that paella!

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sangria
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Piquillo Pepper Rellenos
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chorizo in red Rioja sauce - good accompaniment with other dishes

Pt2nw4aFpOQ_IDvFCijJzw.text: Delicious food and excellent service.  Tapas style and please get the grilled octopus.
