lPcU3UX5n3iue7VQojgBTw.text: We have come to this restaurant once per year for the last 5 years. We always ask our server to recommend a few items after we order a pitcher of sangria. We enjoyed bacon wrapped dates with goat cheese.  Roasted eggplant, onions, and peppers at room temperature. Pimientos rellenos was a great dish. Our favorite was the Churassco, Skirt steak with chimchirri sauce and potatoes. The four of us enjoy these small plates plus a finish of paella to include clams mussels chicken calamari pepperoni tomatoes and rice. Delectable. Excellent service.

qSFnuYIZZzhvg2VIcFh75g.text: As someone who lived several years in Spain, this restaurant reminded me so much of the culture and food of the Iberian country. Love it!

iT7qeW5_5sUdU5qRvtj59Q.text: Friday night I went home and got extremely sick. I can only think it was some kind of bad food eaten at Malabar. We will not be back.

P4jL7aJk3djhukC_dKaP_w.text: My wife and I love this restaurant. It is as close to Spain as you can get in our opinions. Our favorite dish is the paella and the tapas are to die for.

mVa2IXrsvp8GTVYPIpggWQ.text: Phenomenal....yup that pretty much sums this place up. I am shocked to see some mixed reviews on here for Malabar. I went here last night with a group of friends for restaurant week and I can not say one bad thing about the place. Everything from the service to the food was amazing. The great part about there menu for restaurant week is that you can try out a lot of there foods. They gave a choice of two tapas to start, one entree, and one dessert. As far as the entree you had an option with their Paella. If you chose, it was for your standard two people. My girlfriend and I decided that we wanted to try as many tapas as possible and ordered four different tapas. We  got the grilled octopus, calamari, croquetas, and clams with chorizo. All of them were great. The croquetas, clams, and calamari were out of this world. The grilled octopus was good but not on the same level as the other dishes. The sauce from the clams with chorizo were to die for. I used up all the bread on the table to soak up that stuff. We both wanted the Seafood Paella. It was extremely flavorful and came with a good amount of clams, mussels, shrimp, calamari and monk fish. All of the ingredients were perfectly cooked. For dessert we split the flan and the tres leches. I do not a very big sweet tooth but I thought both were really good. The tres leches was super moist.  All of that paired with a nice bottle of Granacha and good friends. Truly a nice evening at Malabar.

EtVODtvW5UQnrs4hhPxyzg.text: Fun place to bring a group, tapas style dining ending with the paella - amazing food, great service! Can't wait to be back. Be sure to make reservations, this place is fairly small.

-aYeO8sr_3a_SZgrtfB5xg.text: We were so excited to taste tapas. We followed previous reviews and we trust them. Very bad idea. We regret for dijing there tonight. We had the grilled octopus, the stuffed pepers, that both were very good. The patatas bravas were the worst potatoes ever. They were the hardest potatoes to chew. We ate 1/6 of the papatas bravas. We had also one paella. When they brought the paella, we could smell a strong smell of something burned. When we served ourselves we could see also that it was burned. We informed the waiter about it; he said this is normal for a paella and we should try avoid scooping hard the pot. He never offered us the chance to replace it or order something else. We could not eat either the paella, since it was more black-burned rice inside. The waiter saw that we did not eat most of the food. We explained him that it is dangerous to eat burned food-coal. He never apologised, brought us the full check without any discount. He just brought us desserts for free, although we answered to him that we did not want any dessert. Lack of customer management and care is very bad for a restaurant. We would never recommend this place to anyone.

3B0X0iUlphdudHpElOgR6w.text: Very disappointed with my experience. Several of us from the suburbs made dinner reservations for 9pm. We were not seated until 10pm. The manager was very rude. Service was horrible!!

nWTKME1RPIPpSnDk-8460A.text: Great find. A real Spanish restaurant with all of the positive things you would normally associate with it. Excellent food (try to Wild Mushroom Tapas). The Marinated White Anchovies were very fresh and perfect. If you've never tried real, fresh anchovies, you should treat yourself to this. Even the sauteed baby spinach tapas was exemplary.  Prices are very reasonable. Street parking is ample at dinner time or you can park in Hearst Tower for next to nothing after 5. The Sangria could have been stronger, but was still very tasty.

OhN7bOgYvORErFDyyphmjw.text: I recently visited Malabar downtown on Tryon ST.  I was blown away by the energy and excellent cuisine served at this Tapas Bar.  The menu has a amazing variety of Spanish dishes so fresh and authentic !  The Paella Royal is a must and well worth the wait!  My server was outstanding and the place was rocking!  The four of us tasted 12 dishes and one was better than the next.  It's a fun dining experience ! Don't leave this place without trying the  Churros and the Crema Catalana desserts!

GBxJtmXrEhK5V9vDfBzIxw.text: If you're in the mood for tapas, stop by recently opened Malabar. I was there for the first time with a party of 14 that the manager graciously made space for. We all walked away super happy with what we ordered whether we opted for tapas or entrees. The wine by the glass is also yum no matter what you order. One of the tapas I had was the asparagus omelet and I cannot get the taste out of my mind - it was that good. One thing I will say, is that I feel like I have already tasted the whole menu for what is available for vegetarians - would be good to have special tapas to get me to come back and try something new!

nou8rX5FqTpD6wmLYNeeDw.text: Best Spanish seafood stew I have ever eaten.  Wonderful broth and tender shrimp, octopus and calamari. We also had the braised rabbit that was an amazing marriage of olive and tomato. We used up all the bread to SOP up every last drop of broth.  Don't miss out on the gazpacho (not sure how you spell that).

6GVKU3kIWsU_mah3UuHmsA.text: Malabar is a typical classic Spanish tapas restaurant. The tapas are simple yet thoughtful. The ambiance is laid-back and the patio is nice for drinks and people watching. Don't go there in a rush. The service is slow and pretty bad. Nevertheless, I'm a fan!

leBh5IB1pNCyoSDVbOwheQ.text: I was really looking forward to dining here,but doubt I'll go back. I sat at the bar at noon. I ordered empanada's and plantains. Oh and coffee.  The empanadas (3 two bites) where bland and had no sauce.  Plantains were awful.  No flavor and weren't seasoned. No one ever came by to ask if I liked the food and never refilled my coffee. I watched four possible two tops leave because nobody greeted them. I spent twenty dollars and I'm still hungry. Too bad I loved COCO'S.

dkUlOkoP2oXsLnJt6_kP0Q.text: i ordered the gambas and tortilla espaniola. i love tortilla but this one wasnt one of the best i've eaten (only okay- maybe because it is an upscale version, not enough seasoning and not oily enough? just lacked some flavor). gambas ("garlic shrimp" on the menu) were delicious, good portion size, served with pan fried potatoes. however, when i inquired whether it is served with rice (I was getting it to go and wanted to confirm I'd be getting a starch with it) the server sharply responded "What? No. We do not have rice here. No rice here." Really? No rice? Half the menu consists of paella options (cooked to order, 2-person order minimum). I guess he meant to say no rice on the side or something like that, but he was literally barking back to me "No rice here" over and over again. Not sure if he was offended somehow by the question, but anyway other than this negative interaction, the kitchen is doing a good job and I had a tasty meal. btw, tres leches dessert hit the spot.

B6NrhqnQmcJIWSy8e1yASg.text: Eating here reminded me a lot of being in Europe, mostly because of the service and atmosphere. Anyone who has been to Europe would know what the service is like there but if not I would not recommend this place if the most important thing to you is very attentive service. Things moved a little slower than most resteraunts in the US but it made it seem like a more authentic experience.   However the food was delicious! Several in our group had been to Spain before and was reminded of it with the food. For everyone else the food was just overall really good! I love tapas and they had a very good variety! My favorite by far was the Croquettes, which are basically fried cheese balls with ham, and are so good!   The paella was also well liked in our group but note that is does take at least 35 minutes to make. We had some people in our group not happy about how long it took but it is made fresh and the menu does mention it on top so when it takes a while it should not be a surprise.

nfzN4oAJ6cp8WAzUqyKIGw.text: Where do I begin? Malabar was one of my favorite parts of my work trip to Charlotte. My coworkers and I decided to check it out because we really wanted some tapas. This place blew us away! Our group of 4 ordered around 11-15 tapas and shared them family-style.   Y'all. We had churrasco steak, spicy mussels, grilled octopus, anchovies, sangria, and tres leches.....just to name a few. I can't remember the rest. All of them were delicious. No, I'm serious. The portions were generous, in my opinion......or maybe it's because I ate some many potatoes......anyway, I enjoyed myself greatly and decided that I now need to visit Spain.....like now.  The prices weren't bad at all. Since all four of us shared everything, we decided to split the bill evenly. Y'all. Guess how much I paid (with tip)? $40! For more than 10 different dishes, flavors, and mouth experiences.....that's an an amazing deal. We all left stuffed and extremely satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Anchovies
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Churrasco
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tres leches

354ulzIplkyYb7tLstppCw.text: This is a good spot to check out. They have a great priced lunch menu with quite a few options. I ordered the Milanesa Sandwich: Lightly breaded chicken breast, avocado,oaxaca cheese, chipotle mayo on ciabatta. The sandwich was good, really filling and they do not skimp on the avocado! You have the options of potatoes or fried yuca with your entree and I did the yuca - it was great, it was paired with a couple really flavorful sauces too.   The location of Malabar is perfect for the uptown crowd, and they have outside sitting if you're wanting to enjoy the weather. The one thing that really stuck out to me upon our visit was the service, the staff and manager were fantastic - very attentive, they gave great recommendations and overall really made our meal a 4 star experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Milanesa Sandwich with fried yuca
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bread Basket served when seated

ACgsfHXNZ_L7MlNlslcXpw.text: We enjoyed our evening here for a birthday group of 12. Scallops were wonderful! $15 for 3 is pricey but worth it, perfectly cooked with amazing garlic lemon butter sauce, dip the bread in it! Dates wrapped in bacon stuffed with goat cheese was lovely. Crispy beef was great. Croquetas were crunchy and filling. Paella was just ok. Expected a different flavor. Meat in paella was cooked perfect. I didn't see it on the menu but we had sliced pork from pigs who only ate acorns it was awesome! Sangria was nice and sweet.   Staff was awesome, always keeping drinks filled and friendly with menu help. Atmosphere is like a classy soccer bar with high ceilings, lovely European style cafe tables, wine bottles, TVs at the bar with Spanish soccer team scarves.

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dates wrapped in bacon stuffed with goat cheese so good!
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice seating
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

HK1aMGtpDkzt5bK_ueQtzA.text: My wife and I took advantage of the Queen's Feast deal last night. We showed up at 5:01 and were greeted by the friendly Malabar staff. They welcomed us while they were setting up for dinner service.  Juan and Alberto were very knowledgeable about wines, Hams and popular Spanish offerings. Both were great examples of fine customer service.  We started with some signature drinks that were lovely. Our appetizer was very fresh calamari. Dinner for me was chorizo, espresso rubbed ribs and tres leches cake. All were great in my opinion. My wife had shrimp ceviche, Mahi mahi and churros for dessert. She enjoyed every bite.  Alberto paired a couple of glasses of wine with our dinner. The perfect compliment. We will definitely be back when the temperatures rise to have the signature sangria and paella. Well done malabar

T1KZ58Pc7zXqqndhrOfuCw.text: My friend and I were meeting up for dinner and decided on Malabar. Since it was restaurant week, she ordered one of the specials. I ordered ala cart, starting with the tablas mixtas- Traditional Spanish meats and cheeses. I especially love manchego . The dish paired well with my wine and the delicious table bread. Our waiter was nice, too. We didn't get any suggestions, so I just  started ordering things that sounded good. I ordered a malbec (Chilean) with my first course then ordered some tapas. I will be back to share an order of the sangria pitcher ($20). Note: This is a traditional Spanish restaurant, so the dinner plates are small. I ordered the spinach and 2 croquetas. Although I planned to order at least another tapa, I was so full! Next time I would like to order the paella to share. They had a lot of dishes that I thought would be unusual to Spain, like ceviche and pasteles tres leches, but everything else did remind me of my trip to Barcelona. My friend had churros as a part of her dessert. She shared with me, and I ordered another a glass of wine. By now, the waiter had become very friendly with us and made sure I had a generous pour. Dessert was excellent. Both of us were very satisfied and plan to return FREQUENTLY. Since there were so many tapas options, this would be especially fun for a date night or to share with a large group of friends.

1h9Xb5jFVuqN4hjLDrXgTw.text: Enjoyed a truly sensational feast at this small, yet exquisite Spanish restaurant tonight (Saturday night, that is). It even exceeded my expectations...especially so given that we had to order off a limited "Queen's Feast" menu. All of our appetizers, entrees and desserts were excellent. Not only delicious, but beautifully presented as well. The service was also exceptional, especially in their perfect timing of our foods and drinks. Lastly, loved the snazzy Spanish music that played overhead, which perfectly complemented the overall dining experience! What more can I say? A-Plus all the way!! Hope to return real soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wine &amp; Sangria
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tres Leches
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Churros

58hbxNbPwUSTBz7DU2E4BQ.text: For first time trying and being new to spanish food all together I would say..Good decent food...hospitality and waiting staff..not good at all..!!   We orderd a shared dish parlla de marriaco and shrims side which was Duh-mazing I loved it..what I fid not enjoy at all is the waiting staff ..

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Paella de marisco

Wvsk86KqKBczEuJTXsTGpA.text: This is a pretty good Spanish tapas place. I think the best strategy when you come here is to come with a group and order a bunch of tapas to share.   I've been here a few times and there are a lot of good things in the menu. The chiles rellenos (stuffed peppers), croquettes, churrasco (skirt steak), and the crispy beef dishes are some of my favorites. The empanadas and garlic shrimp are also very good. This time they had a chorizo special that I was really disappointed by. I'm used to it being juicy and flavorful, but it was a link and very dry.   The service is really good. They are attentive and food comes out as it is ready. They take reservations, but there's usually not a wait when I'm there. It's a pretty small, cute little place. Being tapas style, the price can start to add up, but it's worth it for a special occasion.   This is a great place to go for dinner before a play or show. It's less than a block away from Belk Theater. If you're in the area, I would recommend checking it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chorizo special
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheese plate - comes with honey on top

8A48Ysrnv7epUV0c-MzyEg.text: It's quite a challenge to review Malabar... the restaurant seems to be trapped between its current Spanish incarnation and its former self as Coco Osteria. Killer location on Tryon Street in front of the Hearst Tower, and they have outdoor seating as well. Great ambience too; I really wanted this place to be spectacular, and they're trying, but still seem to be working out the kinks. The manager is very friendly and did his best to accommodate our party of three quickly before Opera Carolina, but the first two wines we ordered- Spanish, naturally- couldn't be found and seemed to cause some confusion; apparently the wine list is still in flux and everything isn't stocked yet. He finally brought us a bottle of Prosecco to keep things moving, which I appreciated, but not exactly what I'd expect at a tapas spot.   The food was good- lamb chops, suckling pig, meatballs, and stuffed dates- and they worked to accommodate our schedule, which we appreciated. We were offered dessert to make up for the wine list no-shows, and out came... tiramisu??? It was great tiramisu, definitely some of the better I've had in Charlotte, but again not what I'd expect from a Spanish restaurant. Overall, I will definitely give Malabar another shot or two, based mostly on the friendliness of the manager and the great location, but I hope they work out what kind of restaurant it wants to be- Italian, Spanish, fusion- and stick with it. Definitely going back for another try.

k2KugarzJ3GqqGF6P99v4g.text: My husband and I arrived with a reservation and were seated right away at a great corner table. Small dining room and high ceilings with lots of windows gave it an intimate yet spacious feel which was naturally bright and welcoming in the early summer evening hour.  Sangria, amazing. Beet salad, amazing. Shrimp, beef, eggplant chips, everything we ordered: amazing. I cannot wait to come back here with friends. The service was impeccable and prompt. Don't miss out on this wonderful uptown spot!

Jd-6bUX7KgZxHckSPCovyA.text: Malabar is definitely our go to spot for tapas in Charlotte. It's so cozy and located right on Tryon St. My husband and I generally grab a couple of seats at the bar (only about 6 seats total) or outside on the patio. The service is always excellent and they almost always have a special or something new on the menu. I also love that they offer a large selection of Spanish wines by the glass and by the bottle. Dishes worth trying- pan con tomate (so good that we almost always order two), churrasco with chimichurri, garlic shrimp, asparagus and mushrooms dish, and the empanadas. This is a great spot for date night or for a birthday dinner with friends, but be sure to make a reservation beforehand as the restaurant does not have many tables. Lastly, the tiramisu does not disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Love this little nook in Uptown
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tiramisu

jBpDODLynL3Gfh5hP4oAqw.text: We went here for valentines day and really enjoyed our experience. We shared the chicken empanadas, stuffed peppers, pan de tomate, and beef churrasco and every dish was well portioned, tasty and well presented. We shared a bottle of wine and a tiramisu as well. Service and atmosphere were great.. would definitely go back!

AnItUNfH2hPVuuhvw2sung.text: Went for a mid-week dinner and ended up on the "patio" area in the courtyard.  It was nicely protected from the wind and was beautifully set up and lit.  We had a lovely, funny security guard "protecting" us all evening.    The menu warns that the paella takes 35 minutes to prepare.  We ordered the Royale (everything) anyway.  It was worth the wait.  It was moist and flavorful, steaming upon delivery with succulent meats, juicy seafood, and a good sprinkling of colorful vegetables.  Between two of us, we got through a quarter of the pan.  Why did we manage to feast so little?  Because we had appetizers and a pitcher of sangria while we waited.  Turns out, they make sangria here exactly the same whether they're using red wine or white--including the fruit and the brandy (yes, they make it with brandy; heck yeah!).  The only difference is the color of the wine.  We went with red this time, but you better believe we'll be back again as it warms up more and we'll be trying the white, too.  The red was delish.  It accompanied our lightly toasted bread and three tapas: wilted spinach with raisins and pine nuts, sauteed asparagus and mushrooms atop what seemed like a roasted red pepper spread, and honey balsamic drizzled eggplant chips.  We loved them.    Because we knew we'd be heavy on the meat and seafood for the paella, the veggie tapas were perfect (PERFECT!) precursurs.  We'd thought about a couple of others, but as I saw neighboring tables order them, although they looked great, I think we made a good choice to stay strictly veggie and avoid any additional cheese or cream.  In the future I'll definitely flip the switch at some point and try meat and cheese tapas with a veggie paella.  So looking forward to future visits!  Malabar, you might end up being my summer love.

vSd0xI0bg_syZ-5Zflu9uA.text: I have been here 3 times! Twice in a row for my birthday. This is a small nice restaurant in a great location. The Paella is delicious and we love the sangria. I received free dessert for my birthday as well. I highly recommend.

N7AEaCJNbSDL38E09cEhow.text: Very poor customer service. Yes, we ordered on doordash, but if you don't want to be on doordash, than simply don't do it. Received a call back saying they didn't have anything we ordered. I completely understand this happens and that is perfectly fine, but it was the way the conversation unfolded that was so rude- short, abrupt, nothing could be done, and no "there is nothing else you can have." You have a whole menu and it is 7pm, what do you mean there is nothing else? Certainly will not have anything to do with this going forward and I guess this is why we had heard so many mixed reviews.

-Q_neww-PYIS9hS8lj6KDw.text: We came, we ate, we conquered Charlotte's Spanish tapas scene at Malabar... and likely won't come back. I'm giving our experience three stars because it's deserving of an "A-OK" description, but we aren't lining up our next trip any time soon.   First and foremost, our seat was in the very back corner of the small, one-room restaurant. Normally I think a smaller restaurant can give off a very intimate feel, but this was a little TOO intimate. I had to stand on my tip-toes to squeeze through to my seat in the corner booth, muttering an apology to the couple next to us as my rear end hovered likely much-to-close to their appetizer (oops, so sorry, that's not very appetizing).   We visited during Queen's Feast so had a more limited menu, and I really wasn't impressed or even intrigued by many of the first course options. We ended up choosing the lentils, which tasted as I had imagined my lentils would taste (and would typically not be a preference for an app), but they were nicely balanced with delicious ham and chicken croquettes (HIGHLY recommend these as a starter!).   My husband ordered the lomo de cerdo asado (i.e. the pork loin) for his main course, later admitting that the pork was dry without a sauce and the vegetables on the side were cold. Pretty disappointing.   I, on the other hand, had a fantastic main course. I chose the Zarzuela (i.e. the Spanish-style fish stew), and it was filled to the brim with delicious seafood. The side of fried yuka was pretty awful (tasted like freezer-burnt french fries), but again, the Zarzuela literally saved my entire dining experience. SO GOOD.  For dessert, my husband chose the flan, and I had the Tres Leches, which was mouth-wateringly tasty.   One last recommendation if you choose Malabar for your dining experience - go for the red wine sangria. It was very flavorful, a decent-sized pour, and helps you look past some not-so-palatable moments.

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Loom de Cerdo Asadi con Salsa Miel de Salvia Word of advice: ask for extra sauce for the pork.
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Yucca ... at least the basil dipping sauce was nice??
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Zarzuela - Spanish-style seafood strew, filled with scallops, calamari, oysters, salmon, and shrimp. Seriously delicious, people.

stvxFID1KdeY14hybWT18w.text: We came for tapas and weren't disappointed!  We got salmon bruschetta, meatballs and empanadas. Everything we had was delicious! We sat outside and it was perfect - there wasn't any wind and it was nice and quiet. I would recommend ordering 3-4 tapas per two people.

d5OW_GVx5y9cNAAFUx2Cnw.text: My overall experience was great at this restaurant. I love tapas style dining and this place did not disappoint. From lamb chops to octopus to meatballs, everything was so tasty. Staff did fantastic job as well.

DUkjcbF8tsAoyNtf_PK4ig.text: Malabar offers a memorable tapas experience in the heart uptown Charlotte.   The small cozy interior appears more spacious through the use of mirrors and windows. The high ceilings and fabulous chandelier make the space very relevant and modern.  Malabar offers True Spanish tapas--exactly what you would find at a restaurant in Spain. I went with a group of girlfriends so we were able to try quite of a few options.  The croquettes con jamon y queso were wonderful: creamy, fried pillows with great flavor. The order of patatas bravas, french fries with a spicy red sauce and a creamy aioli, was generous. Pimientos rellenos were the star of the show--red bell peppers stuffed with rice and other delicious morsels. The churrasco, beef with a chimichurri sauce was great. Don't miss the tortilla! Made out of potatoes and eggs, it's truly delicious!! I would skip the mussels as they were gritty and the broth was too salty.   My friends said the white sangria was awesome, and the drink menu was extensive. Malabar is sneakily pricey though, so be cautious. Each tapa is $10-12 and the portions aren't that big. Malabar is perfect for happy hour noshing, or a drink and snack after a show in Uptown.

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mussels, patatas bravas, churrasco, oh my!!
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pretty interior.
Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Drink menu at Malabar.

ZAUJoWhuQLlWFQLM3phtAA.text: This place is one of the best places I have been to in a long time.  The food is truly flavorful and authentic.  I went for lunch and got the pollo sandwich with Fiery Potatoes.  The sandwich has so much flavor it felt like your mouth was going to Spain.  It's one of the best sandwiches I have had and for $9 you can't beat it.  The fiery potatoes were awesome because it added an extra kick to the meal.  The staff is good and prompt.

Ox_9q0seDh6196TgAQY5qg.text: I love tapas bars!!!  The new place which opened where Coco Osteria used to be is a lovely surprise.  I hadn't even known they opened, but was pleased to see a new small plates option in town.  The ambiance is warm and cozy, inviting conversation and intimacy.  The service was friendly and attentive, with glasses always filled and food delivered promptly.  The dishes we tried were fresh and flavorful...Grilled calamari with rosemary and fresh lemon (mmmm!), Dorado over julienned vegetables was a lovely combination, eggplant bruschetta was savory and delicate, and the mussels were spicy and delicious.  The only plate that disappointed was the fried plantains (sort of bitter and the dipping sauce lacked flavor and, in my opinion, did not pair well).  Really looking forward to coming back again.

c66zt0MJUy4goFOHKv_45A.text: Went here with two friends during a recent conference in Charlotte. I really like the small plate concept and Malabar offers many choices on the dinner menu. In addition to the small plates, Malabar offers entrees and a selection of paella.  We sat outside and each ordered three plates from the menu. The tapas menu offers categories of meat, vegetables, cheese.and seafood.  Standouts were the Vaca Frita, (crispy beef with pickled onions) Croquetas, (ham, potato and manchego cheese) and the Lenteja, (lentils, ham and sofrito) from the Carne menu. Tigres (mussles in spicy red sauce), Pulpo (grilled octopus with potatoes and green and olives and the Calamar a la Plancha (Grilled Calamari) on the Seafood menu.  From the Vegetable menu we had the Patatas Brava (spicy potatoes), Tortilla Espanola (potato, onion omelette) and Championes (sauteed wild mushrooms).  With 9 dishes ordered, the waitress asked how we wanted them served. I said to leave it up to the kitchen and just bring them out three at a time. Great pairings of dishes on each "course".

sq_gHcqwi6PVCwsdTHsXvA.text: We are new in Charlotte, and according  to most reviews this place had a promising experience. WELL ....  Not for us, we called ahead and made reservations, a man answered and put me on hold twice coming back to me to tell me that at 9pm would be better, so I asked if it's ok to wait at the bar( I only asked cause some reviews said the place was very small), then he put me to a woman that confirmed my reservation for 8:30 took name last name and cell#. We arrive a little before 8:30 and the man I spoke with said there are no reservations under our name for the night....:( he said no reservations are recorded in the system. OK... i said, " I recall speaking with you before confirming the reservation with a woman", he went off to check again and said he would accommodate a table for us and gave us Sangria on the house.  Yeah it did look disorganized, I agree with a previous yelper, the service wasn't as professional as expected, but we were there already.  The food was not really that great, we ordered the Churrasco which was the suggestion from the waiter, over the special of the night, although it was very tasty was a very small portion, Tapas basic, and bread cold no olive oil or butter to go along with, surely not worth over $100, I think I will have to pass next time.

HKGIBWQ4d4qPQ5eqNv7fkQ.text: We decided to go to Malabar because they advertise the $9.95 lunch on their website.  This is no longer available at the restaurant though.  The waiter did not know what was on the menu, was confused when I asked him questions, and went missing once we received our food.  We had to wait until the end of our meal before the hostest came over to us.  They had left off half of my husband's meal.  They brought it out quickly.   The food was ok.  It was flavorful, just not the flavors that I prefer.  Mine was greasy too.  My favorite was the dip for the yuca side.  I will not be going here again.

rW6QAnmV53JZjsaBBhZKQQ.text: I recently tried out this Tapas establishment expecting to be hungry 15mins. after I ate.  This was not the case.  I am not usually a fan of Tapas for this reason, too little food too much money.     We started out with an Artichoke appetizer which was really just one little square of an Artichoke mix atop a slice of bread.  I ordered a nice Malbec but tried the Red Sangria and wish I had ordered that for the entire meal, it was delightful.   For our entree we had the Paella Royal, Sliced chorizo, Croquettes and Fiery Potatoes.  This was my first Paella but I know how the dish is made so it wasn't a total surprise.  I have to say, I avoided the baby Octopus and Prawns because they just freaked me out.  I'm used to my Octopus wrapped in sushi rice so there's a bit of a disconnect and I don't like beheading my meal before eating it.   Overall, the Paella was delicious but again, this is my first order of it.  The vegetables were cooked perfectly as was the various meat in the dish.  The pork rib in the meal did lack some actual Pork so that was a slight disappointment.  The sliced Chorizo tapa was smaller and sliced thinner that what I was expecting, think Prosciutto. It was good and we still didn't finish it so I suppose it doesn't matter that it was so thin.  I do highly recommend the Fiery potatoes (potatoes Brava!).  They came with a white sauce drizzled on top and just enough seasoning to have flavor without really being "Fiery".  The Croquettes were a little gooey but to be fair, they did only contain potatoes and manchego.     By accident, our server brought an order of what I believe to be Albondigas (beef meatballs).  Now, we were too involved in our conversation to really remember what we ordered so we did eat one meatball a piece before the server realized that it wasn't our order.  The meatballs were very good and I would recommend ordering them if you're into that sort of thing (meatballs without pasta or a bun).   This brings me to the service.  I'd like to point out that the place was slammed packed.  I was asked for my drink order within a few moments of seating but it took a long time to actually receive my wine.  I noticed that we weren't the only table that received the wrong food.  The table next to us also got an extra order of something along with the Sangria that I ordered.  I'd like to point out that it took a LOOOONG time for me to actually get my Sangria and our server never came around to make sure we were ok.  I did see other servers circling the restaurant so I don't know what the deal was with our side of the room.     For better service, try to dine here Mon-Wed. nights as it is insane on a Thursday (you know,pre-weekend).  With all the Tapas restaurants in Charlotte, this one didn't hold my taste buds enough to bring me back but instead to try other places.

M4CfHmmhRwUQftfzM15Ppw.text: Having lived in Spain, I had high expectations for this place and they were pretty much met - we got the seafood paella, croquetas and champinones (shrooms) and while I didn't feel like the croquetas and champinones brought me back to Spain, they were delicious.  The tres leches was amAzing. I do wish it was darker/cozier - the large windows make it feel like you're in a fishbowl.  Looking forward to trying more of their tapas.  The service was very good.

l7t4sBWAcWyS2EN4NAkixA.text: Today was my second time in this place! We had several tapas, and we did not go wrong with any of our selection, tonight we had champinones, croquetas and pulpo-they were all extremely delicious. The tempranillo sangria was good as well. =] you need to try this place!

oEwZk32IWktOO50iNnfSKA.text: Terrific meal, good service, the ubiquitious Gypsy Kings wailing in the background. Seated within 10 minutes of our reservation. The batatas bravas (cubes of potatoes spiced with hot paprika), yuca with a cilantro aioli, beef empanadas, and eggplant romesco to start with paella or shrimp, chicken, mussels, clams and chorizo. Finish with tres leches cake and sweet empanadas. Good sangria and espresso. We're planning on a return visit for sure

_yQF-uilynGlqkM93QQgvA.text: Quaint place. Get a reservation if you have more than 2 people. One of the few places around town you can order 'sharing plates' and try a little of everything.

cK0u5jc4yCD0zMFTMAL7YA.text: We visited while in town for work, and had a nice evening on the patio with some sangria (both white and red were yummy) and a couple of tapas. The servers were a tiny bit slow, but very nice. Overall a good visit!

z633JI_iCJa-6hAfh9w_Xw.text: Awful service! Over 10 mins wait to place drink and food order and the place was not busy at all. Not worth it

oYZ5QBq8sOV4MWz2WtZIew.text: Great selection of tapas incl veggie items. Try the chili rellenos.  Very tasty . Enjoy!

4B6oVH4PDVAYV1sPkyzy7A.text: I went to Malabar during Queen's Feast. I've been wanting to visit this restaurant for a while now. I wasn't completely disappointed but, I'm not in a rush to get back. I wanted to start my meal with a cocktail. I was expecting to see a different variety of Rums, some Cachaca, something Spanish inspired. If memory serves me correct, a few of the drinks had Malibu Coconut rum and of course the Pisco Sour. I started my meal with the Gambas (shrimp). To put a long story short...they tasted rotten. Strangely, rotten. For my main course I had the Red Snapper (a La Plancha) with Wilted Spinnach. It was really amazing. Probably some of the best tasting Spinach I've had and the Snapper was cooked to perfection. Something I would try to recreate at home. For dessert I had the Tres Leches cake. It had a mild coconut flavor and it was good, nothing really outstanding. I really like the atmosphere at Malabar and the food is okay. Would I go back? Probably some time in the Spring to have cocktails al fresco and watch the people on the street.

PtqKA03Xs9MASPgPUrSi5w.text: Went for date nite with the hubby. We are both from miami and huge fans of tapas. That said we decided to try this place out. Ambience was nice with some latin music in the background which was a plus. We had a carafe of sangria which was very tasty! We decided to have two tapas and the paella for two. All were delicious! I highly recommend the creamy ham, potato, and manchego croquetas and the grilled baby octopus. The paella was really good and had lots of seafood and meat along with crispy rice! We were too full for dessert but had to order a tres leches to go... Midnite snack! Cool place to go for date night but i would sit at the bar next time as it gets pretty loud! Park at the hearst towers..restaurant is in that plaza! A little on the pricey side but i enjoyed it!

FjtXVidTYimex4rfQvZpjA.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. Croquettas, Patatas Bravas, Churrasco, and Albondigas are all of my favorites. Service is very attentive and friendly. Always walking around to make sure your glass is full and you have everything you need. Easy to make reservations on Open Table. Definitely suggest giving this play a try for lunch or dinner.

vCb5IyETNUFK0X9wZKL3iw.text: I just got home from Malabar. My belly is stuffed. I had the Paella de Pescado (seafood paella) and it was soooo delicious.  The dish was for two, and I shared it with a dinner companion, but I still ended up taking home about half of it because it was so filling. So many delicious things on the menu, I can't wait to visit again.

v_xdwN26NDZDdZ6daeJAkA.text: Well priced. Excellent artful food with fresh ingredients. One of the best quality lunches you get uptown (nutritional, tasty, affordable). I am always shocked that this place is not busier. Excellent service too. Try the perfectly dressed watercress sales with lamb skewers! Also love the stuffed peppers.

VndFoI5AgEH6yYnx3FznNQ.text: Terrible service.  Bad food.  Manager was rude and they forgot parts of our order and refused to split a check.  Not going back.

e6a8MIB1mlbeqErl0GOjYg.text: If you like real Spanish Tapas, this restaurant is a must.  All dishes are great.  I particularly loved the vaca frita.  My wife loves the remolacha con pollo.  We live in Durham and Malabar is one of the main reasons we visit Charlotte!

X4n1EDdNHURDiujlQ6CgPg.text: OK...acting on a recommendation from a great foodie partner....had to try Malabar today!  First the location and ambience was great.  I like the decor of traditional mixed with art deco.  The full wall of mirrors makes the restaurant look very large.  So...the lunch menu offered great appetizers, tapas, sandwiches and more.  Appetizer was eggplant bruschetta.  Very good.  Followed by a great salad of mixed greens...that included a goat cheese croquette...yummy!  The small basket of bread with side of EVOO was a nice touch.  The chicken croquettes served on a small plate with a nice sauce was very good.  The chicken empanadas were just so good.  You could see and taste the red peppers as you bit into them.  Service was amazing for someone that had just started that day!  Very impressed. Looking forward to a return visit at night when the restaurant will be full of people!!!

G9D-JgrACOWXQZ8TjtUgEw.text: It was really about a 4.5. We were really happy with our visit. Started with chicken empinadas and they were great. Had the Paella Pescado as the entree and it was awesome. Excellent seafood. Highly recommend it. Good service too but not spectacular enough to earn a 5.  We will be back for the Paella!

fAuGpX8QeV6xVH-7FZ0m4Q.text: Despite it being a Friday night in Uptown Charlotte, there were no crowds busting at the doors - the atmosphere was the perfect balance of relaxed and upscale. Along with the great ambience came great food.   For starters, our server brought us complimentary Spanish flatbread covered with a light tomato sauce. It was very refreshing and made me excited for the rest of the meal. My friend and I ordered three tapas:  - Pimientos Rellenos, stuffed roasted peppers -Tigres, mussels in spicy red sauce. My friend who doesn't even like seafood enjoyed them, so I would say they are pretty special.  -Albondigas, beef meatballs with tomato sauce. This is the dish I would recommend to anyone who comes to Malabar. Not only were the meatballs exceptional in texture and taste, but the sauce was what really what blew me away. It was all at once rich, light and creamy that it became the main part of our meal because we couldn't stop dipping our bread in it.   While I didn't order it this time, I will be stopping by Malabar soon to try their paella. I hear that they are made to order and would take 35 minutes to prepare. I will keep you posted and find out if it is as good as it sounds!

XICxGaiRtzaTZVuw1rNFFw.text: My wife and I were in town for the weekend for a Bitcoin conference and decided to make this our last meal before hitting the road based on some good Yelp recommendations. As always, when we travel, Yelp is our north star! Anyway, so this place actually beat our expectations. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the place had a cool ambiance, we enjoyed a nice tempranillo wine, and shared the meat paella, which hit the spot.

GXbNZdkxJaZv179c6V3v_w.text: Wow! This made my first visit to Charlotte a great time. The food here is amazing.  I've been to a few other Spanish restaurants in the U.S. and Spain before and this place really impressed me. I unfortunately did not try the paella, but I did have churrasco and calamari tapas and loved every bite. The sangria was spot on also...thank you!

dJZFABXsPPo3T3QSoS-Jxg.text: We decided that being a Tapas joint, Malabar would be a big hit during Restaurant Week. I'm a fan of sampling a bunch of different bites, and with the menu offering two Tapas, an entree and dessert this was a no-brainer to try. While nothing really blew us away it was still a very good meal.  We ate outside at Malabar, which was a good choice. My brief glimpse at the interior made me think of a cramped, dark, loud restaurant. On the other hand, the outdoor area had about ten tables there ran along a single line, so there were no strangers to do battle with for elbow space or to be inadvertently eavesdropping on each others conversations.   Our server was very friendly, though a bit needy. She popped by a bit too often, which isn't a bad thing at all...I'd rather the server come by too many times then not enough. The wine menu was interesting and offered some wines I was not familiar with, and the prices were reasonable. After delivering the wine some fresh bread and olive oil was brought over. I was surprised at how good the olive oil was...this is definitely the real deal they serve to dip your bread in, and not some cheap stuff they buy at Sam's Club or something in bulk.   For my Tapas I went with the Croquetas and the Pulpo. The Croquetas consisted of two mashed potato, ham and manchego cheese logs all deep fried to perfection. It was very tasty, and I loved how the potato and cheese melded together. However it got heavier with each bite, and I eventually got sick of it before finishing. It wasn't bad tasting at all, but just very heavy and rich, and too much was not good. The Pulpo was a generous portion of grilled octopus, potatoes and olives on a plate with some paprika or some other red seasoning/sauce. While I love calamari I was not a fan of the octopus. I don't think it was anything Malabar did wrong, but I just don't think I personally like the taste of octopus. It was very tender (which I wasn't expecting) but had a strange taste I did not care for.   The missus ordered the Garbanzo and Tigres. The Garbanzo is just what it sounds like...a heaping pile of chick peas. They were cooked pretty well and had some spinach mixed in with them, and they made for a nice, light appetizer. The Tigres are mussels that were cooked in a slightly spicy tomato sauce. The missus is a mussel fiend and she enjoyed both the shellfish themselves as well as the sauce. The Tigres came with one lone hunk of toasted bread to dip in the sauce, and once that was consumed the two of us finished off the table service bread with that delicious sauce.  For an entree (they call platos) I got the Churrasco. This is a grilled flank steak (at least that's my educated guess on the cut of meat) that is marinated in a chimichurri sauce. The steak was cooked to order (medium rare) but was still a touch tough. The sauce was done very well, though there was waaaaaay too much garlic in it. My plate was covered with probably over a hundred small chips of garlic, and that's just too much. It was served with some yucca fries and cilantro sauce that was good. The yucca was cooked good and had a simple taste, but the cook definitely had a heavy hand with the cilantro when it came to the sauce.  The missus went with Gambas al Ajo, which was a bowl of about eight jumbo shrimp. The shrimp were cooked in a tasty garlic sauce and had a nice, fresh bite to them. For a side she was given an order of patatas bravas which we both loved. These little potato wedges were cooked with a slight spice and served with a garlicy creamy sauce that was pretty tasty.  For dessert we both split an order of the Tres Leches cake and Empanadas Dulces. The Tres Leches cake was a super moist cake topped with whipped cream and caramel drizzle. This thing was SOAKED, and was almost like a sponge with all the sweet, sweet sugary milk it absorbed inside. I really enjoyed this dessert and recommend it, so long as you have a sweet tooth. The Empanadas Dulces were kind of like homemade Pop Tarts. The two pastries came out piping hot on the outside, and molten on the inside. The exterior pastry was flaky and had a decent taste to it, though I found it to be slightly bland. The interior was some kind of strawberry jam that was like lava. It was scorching hot and thick, and oozed out as you took each bite and erupted all over the table. I wasn't too crazy about it, and definitely preferred the Tres Leches.  Malabar has some pretty good eats in a nice location. I'm a sucka for Tapas so I'm sure we will be coming back to try more of these little bites.

smmqY2vSxP9xw330PZzhQA.text: This is my new favorite spot. After going to Spain last year I have been dying to find authentic Spanish tapas in Charlotte. My husband and I tried to give this place a whirl. We started with the spanish meatball and the croquetas. The croquetas were awesome. Very flavorful. The Spanish meatballs were just ok. The flavor was good but it could have used a little salt. Then we  tried the rellenos (stuffed peppers). This was AMAZING. The cheese was great, the flavor and texture were spot on. After that we both had desserts. I had the chocolate mousse which came out in a cool little glass and was so decadent. My husband had tres leches. I am not a fan so didn't even bother trying it, but he thought it was great. The only thing I did find disappointing was the sangria. It had a little bit of a cocnutty flavor in it and wasn't very strong. I can't wait to go back here again to try some more tapas.

Pn0LThYfhyfYtvsvetx23g.text: We went for girls night out on Saturday night and did the Queens Feast menu.  The Queen's Feast menu is great!  Plenty of options for $30.  We started with mojitos which are all made fresh, so it takes a little longer than pouring a glass of wine, so order as soon as you sit down.  Some of my favorite tapas: clams, mussels, crispy marinated beef, grilled calamari -so good - (it's the whole calamari, may not be what you are expecting, but so good!).  For the entrees we ordered paella, grilled skirt steak with chimichurri sauce and monkfish.  All very good.  We ordered too much paella - we had 6 of us and we should have gone for one more entree and ordered one less paella.  So, that would have been 4 entrees and 1 paella and that would have been enough. Lastly was dessert and we love the Tres Leches!  If you like chocolate the Chocolate & Cafe Mousse was good too!  The service, as usual, was great.  Very attentive.  We also got there right as at our reservation time and we able to sit down right away, which was very nice.  Great time and good food!

kmrbCjqAkCQrfjSPuwXlSw.text: I dined at this lovely restaurant last night with my husband, father-in-law and another couple.   We all absolutely loved everything we tried. We decided just to order lots of tapas for the whole table to share and I'm so glad we went this route. The croquetas were moist and the sauce they lay on was absolutely delicious. The favorite at the table was the almejas a la mancha which were clams and chorizo in a red sauce.  I could have made this my whole meal. We loved the Jamon Serrano!  Enough that we ordered two. We also devoured two of the Tortilla Espanola, a potato and onion omelet.  The great thing about tapas is that I usually have room left for dessert and I'm so glad I did in this case. The churros were served hot and with a delicious melted chocolate sauce! I'm not a huge flan fan but my husband absolutely loved it. The tres leche was superb but my favorite was the empanadas dulces which was berries and bananas in a pastry crust.  Lastly I must mention the sangria was excellent!  They chop their fruit up in tiny bite size pieces which we found genius.  I can't wait to do this next time I make Sangria at home.  Really looking forward to returning to this great establishment. Try it and you won't be disappointed!

yn7K481cOImNT-0C13kUhQ.text: Great Spanish dining experience.  I live in the Charlotte area and have work responsibilities in Spain and have become huge fan of the food and especially the wine.  Both are well represented at Malabar.  I highly recommend the octopus, and the empanadas were as good as any that I've had anywhere.

Le-E8YRkwnWxzD5CZqo74Q.text: Just OK - not really Spanish. Mediocre wine list and big appetizers vs True tapas. I would say very American food with Spanish music playing.

Gyj7PHeI7jmPdzTRITTVkg.text: Oh stop it with the bring back CoCo Osteria already (he says with a loving smile).  That place was a good Italian restaurant, but with a second Italian white table cloth restaurant by the same owner less than 100 feet away, trying something different was a great idea.  Now you find Malabar in it's rightful place.  Small but suitable patio for outside eating, great staff that warmingly greets you, a lot of wonderful options in food, and if you're willing to be a little daring, you can venture out with some new options.  They have a great mix of Spanish cuisine.  There's a healthy mix of Cuban, Puerto Rican, and some Mexican dishes around.  My favorite is the lamb by far.  I try to avoid meat when I can but it's quite irresistible here.  A close second would be the stuffed peppers and the potato dishes.  Really good stuff.  On top of that, fore being such a small place, they have a great bar and an excellent wine selection.  The manager Angelo always has me pushing my boundaries and trying something new.  I'll be damned if he's not right most of the time.    Check it out, try it out and if nothing else you'll come away with a great experience.  Or you'll be like me and coming back for more and more and more...

8MLqvHeQHn1VGjx2iTUG-w.text: I can't tell you how excited I am that Malabar opened in Charlotte. After living in Spain for a year, this is as close as it gets to Spanish food. Mind you the waiters are not all from Spain and some of the food like canelones is italian and yukka is central/south american.   Came here for my friend's birthday. They were so great that they catered to all 15ish of us on separate checks, bless their heart, it's not the norm, but they were nice enough to accomodate us. And take a million pictures of us on our iphones.   I'd recommend getting a whole bunch of tapas split between everyone as opposed to one tapa or entree for yourself. My eyes were bigger than my stomach and I was in a painful food coma after dinner bc I attempted a full course meal: 1 tapa, 1 churrasco, and the tres leches cake. Too many good tapa options here: patatas bravas, canelones, albondigas, croquetas, lomo, tortilla patata, jamon serrano, the list goes on...).   I can't wait to go back...I'd like to try the paella but be aware that you must call ahead because it takes 35 minutes to prepare.

Zlff4WYmQU7bRpB36TJaOw.text: So I'm completely confused as to why a Spanish tapas restaurant is called "Malabar" when that word usually refers to an area of India, but no one consulted me when they (mis)named the eatery.   What I'm not confused about is how delicious the food was, and how impressed I was with our unflappable server. Even when he was confronted with a table of seven raucous blogger type ladies in town for a blog convention, he suggested dishes to share which suited the vegetarians and two of us who have shellfish allergies. As our Friday night dinner hour went on, however, he appeared to be oversat, and that affected his timing on refreshing drink orders.   We were sucking down the red and white Sangria like we knew what we were doing. He needed back up, and if you drink enough of that light and refreshing Sangria on a hot summer evening, you will, too.   The Paellas were excellent and served in the pans in which they are cooked, and two orders were enough for all of us to share along with several small plates. The Croquetas, Pimientos Rellenos and the Manchego were among my favorites, and I wish now that I had ordered the Yuccas Fritas.   It filled up pretty quickly during our visit, so I would definitely suggest a reservation at this taste of Spain in uptown Charlotte.

6CDMNLlzh6kHyzgIPx6cEw.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants. I eat here at least twice when visiting from NJ. I love their croquetas, churrasco (skirt steak), and churros. I tried the tres leches cake but wasn't crazy about it. Their takeout is also the best. Food is ready in 15-20minutes and tastes great!

0ylKV58A5gFebx7Ett7_qA.text: There don't seem to be a lot of top notch spanish restaurants around charlotte but this one is awesome.  We stopped in for restaurant week and sampled a ton of their dishes and each one was better than the last. My personal favorite was the paella which was great since I had actually been hunting around town for some for a while now.   The interior of this place is very comfortably decorated however the seating is very limited. Be sure and call at least a couple days ahead for a reservation if you want to get a decent time for dinner.

02qdVim64uCRuaC5QgiM1Q.text: I was taken here on a late afternoon when i was feeling particularly Hangry. The last place I wanted to go to was a Tapas place when all I wanted to do was eat a big bowl of pasta. I'm so happy that I came here. I tried the beef empanadas, mussels, potatoes bravas, shrimp, and barbecued shredded beef-- they were all extremely delicious.  Couple things to consider: this place is tiny. I would call ahead for a reservation. There is outdoor seating (limited) The service was slow. The only person who really shined was the quiet older woman who saw the hunger in my eyes and proceeded to fill my bread basket without asking about 4 times.

8mNeG171Jz0Isf-6zJrC7w.text: We've paid several visits to Malabar, the first was amazing and the others that followed were just so-so.  We have always enjoyed Toscana, our favorite Conti restaurant so we expected our continued visits to hold up at Malabar. During our first stop, the bartender helped us choose a nice red wine, there were vegetarian items included in the specials, and the chef treated us to a few more off the menu. It was truly a great experience.  During our next visit, about a week later, that bartender didn't work there anymore,we had few meatless options, and the staff seemed very disorganized. They changed our waiter midway through our meal, the wine list had already changed, the experience was clearly not as pleasant as the first. We visited another time or two and felt the same inconsistency with the wine and the staff.  We came back the last time with friends, only because it was prearranged, hoping for a better experience. The staff still seemed to be a little disorganized and the food not nearly as wonderful as our first visit, when the chef had time to treat us.  We may give Malabar another try, but it's already been a few months.

fnYyCvrrdCE3oQW2HdTN1g.text: Service was mediocre. Food was good but too much of each item for tapas. To be a good tapas place I recommend doubling the items on the menu, halving the portions, not-quite-halving the prices. This recommendation has nothing to do with me knowing a thing about tapas, just about what I like...a little of this, a bite of that. :-)

RLsksp6a7NEr5GQmrSwr2Q.text: Four of us checked out Malabar during Restaurant Week. None of us had visited before so we were all excited to see what we've been missing. We were immediately impressed with the warm but modern decor but felt a little bit squeezed into our table in the middle of the room.   Our options from the Restaurant Week menu were incredible. We could pick 2 tapas, 1 entree, and 1 dessert. Because there were 4 of us, we tried to order 8 different tapas - brilliant. They were delicious. The seafood tapas options were the highlights... We didn't hit it out of the ballpark, however, for our entree. Both couples decided to order paella. 2 people must order & share - FYI! Silly us, there were other entree options we liked but we felt like we HAD to order paella. It was ok. Just ok. I am glad I tried it - I was able to recreate a similar version at home after our visit - but, truly, I wasn't overjoyed. I wouldn't order it again - next time I might just stick with the tapas menu.   Our one issue... We brought our own wine ($15 corkage fee - no problem) and our server gladly opened our bottles for us. After realizing we were pressed for space, we probably shouldn't have requested 2 wine glasses apiece - but we did. In an attempt to make room before our food came, our server combined glasses of wine - without asking! Ugh. Other than that, our server was excellent, the secondary staff helping with bread & water were hit  or miss - mainly due to language barriers.   Check out Malabar - Charlotte is lucky to have this delicious, Spanish restaurant in uptown.

fq7LND3XxClNsDGau795_w.text: I had dinner here with a group of 7 colleagues. We all thought the food was pretty good and the ambiance, relaxing.  We arrived at around 8:30 pm and were seated fairly quickly. The host, who doubles up as the guy who takes your order is warm and welcoming. Once seated, we ordered a round of drinks, including a pitcher of sangria. I thought the sangria was a bit insipid and not-so-great but not horrible.  We ordered an assortment of tapas to share across the table, and we all thought the food was pretty good. I was a bit underwhelmed by the lamb chops. I would have liked them to have more flavor. The churrasco was REALLY good, as were the shrimp. The chicken empanadas were very tasty, but could use a bit more chicken :(  The few vegetarian items we ordered were pretty decent as well, but nothing to write home about.  I strongly recommend the churrasco and the shrimp. Overall, I would like to come back and try this place again and hopefully agree with all the 4-star reviewers!

kdaSWQ8QG8D5Wz8Rvp3R_g.text: This restaurant makes no sense. They open up all these available times on OpenTable, but when your party shows up, the whole restaurant is full, and they have no available tables for at least 30-45 min from when you reserved. This has happened to me 3 times in a row, all when booking through open table. If you're not going to honor the reservation times, don't use open table. Especially when you have a limited waiting area (basically no waiting area) and you have guests clogging up the entrance, bar, and outside.

BrpA6yDCQUf_eSZuzkeo2g.text: I love this restaurant. The beer and wine selection is great. If you like black beers, I recommend the Xingu. The paella is freaking amazing. The mushrooms and empanadas are also killer. Service is always impeccable and the atmosphere is quiet and elegant. Makes a nice date night location.

HGeoPnzD6GLesA60T_UVeA.text: I came to this restaurant with really high expectations given the reviews and comments from a few friends.   The restaurant is nice inside and has outdoor seating which is a plus.   Once we got seated, a gentlemen which I assume was the manager served us. He was very reserved, even slightly awkward. Although he did everything he needed to, I didn't get any hospitality from him. No welcome, suggestion, or presentation from the menu.   People like this make it seem as if they don't want to be there. Enthusiasm even if faked can make patrons feel more at home.  My date and I ordered the seafood paella. I was really hoping it would taste similar to the paella I've hadin Barcelona, Madrid, and Andalucia...but it fell quite short.   The patella is I think $16 or $18 per person and a paella for two had the following: two jumbo shrimp, two scallops, lots of mussels a few clams and calamari and sofrito.  The scallops were cooked perfectly nice and soft but the fact there was only two was a big disappointment. The shrimp were decent but again only two. The clams and mussels were good but those are hard to screw up on.   The calamari was WAY overcooked to the point it was rubbery. Ew. It also tasted very bland.   Overall the dish just lacked protein. It's as if they load you up on the cheap stuff (calamari and mussels) and give you just a teasing amount of the really good stuff (shrimp and scallops). If you are gonna charge a premium for a quintessential Spanish dish, at least give it more value or at a minimum a picture showing what to expect.   If I would have known it was just two shrimp and two scallops plus cheap seafood i would have gotten something else.   I will be back to try the seafood stew and perhaps a tapa or two. Hopefully my opinion of this restaurant will change then.

N3aeQV0SBSSbWXa1Au4jCQ.text: We had a lovely dinner at Malabar during restaurant week.  The men both enjoyed the seafood stew, and the women loved the halibut special with eggplant.  We each had a different dessert and shared them--they were all different, but we all agreed that you couldn't go wrong with any selection, and they made a nice ending to a relaxing, delicious dinner with friends.  Service was excellent--knowledgeable and friendly.  I highly recommend Malabar.

SZznvo1r1pV5les7MzFLMw.text: Had a birthday dinner for a friend was able to drop off a cake before we had dinner. The calamari was on point. This was our first time here so we tried more. The steak was cooked perfectly melted in your mouth. Lovedddddddd the eggplant ravolis. Absolutely want some more. Great chorizo and amazing staff. Wait staff was very attentive always filling our drinks. Cute cozy place. Loved it. Cannot wait to go back again.

1ujoXOEBucDF-g9usMAyiw.text: We went out for dinner and had a seafood paella. It was delicious. Portion was definitely good for 2 people. Lots of seafood. Great atmosphere, good and quick service.

_rnNK7I0q6SLqeMBytDHJQ.text: My friend, Leslie and I ventured into Malabar in Charlotte one nice, balmy night for some sangria to get away from the Epicenter untz untz. IF you get me. ON first sight, the manager is suave. The heat pours off of him and it makes you want to drink the sangria mucho gusto.. :-) We had the paella, which takes a bit of time to prepare, but worth the wait. In the mean time, we opted for a sample of tapas: Croquettes; empanadas; and pimentos with manchego.. we opted for the pitcher of red sangria and its well worth it. Left there sangria swayed. AND had to come back the next night.. you know.. just to sip the sangria.. Una vez mas:-)

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States

FFkHcJJv39pwgvoyeh801Q.text: Decided to give Malabar a try while we were in Charlotte for the day. We love tapas and reviews of Malabar were pretty good. We tried the croquettes, sauteed mushrooms, and beef empanadas. The croquettes and empanadas were awesome-full of flavor! I liked that the empanadas featured shredded beef-they reminded me of ropa vieja in an empanada shell. The ham and cheese croquettes were also really good-crispy outside with a creamy center. Several other reviews had suggested the mushrooms, saying they are really good paired with the bread but I found the bread to be a bit dense and almost stale and the mushrooms to be just okay. I can make better sauteed mushrooms at home. The atmosphere was also just okay, decent outside seating, nice to be downtown, but nothing overly impressive. Overall, good experience. I would go back for the croquettes if I were in Charlotte again, but I wouldn't make a special trip just to try Malabar. If you've been to Mateo in Durham, it's 1,000x better for a tapas night and worth a special day trip any day of the week. Was hoping I would feel the same about Malabar but it just didn't leave me with the same impression.

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef empanadas, ham and cheese croquettes, mushrooms, house bread.

iteeZc6TUwrL3owjvkXSpw.text: We loved this place.   Sauteed mushrooms amazing, stuffed peppers (pequillo?)awesome, skirt steak w chimichurri great and cooked correctly and ok so I don't know how to spell most of this stuff and I think my spell check is messed up or maybe it's the wine but you get the drift.   Nice place and hope to return soon.

2Xz8oAe6lhCt0WzmIpIk1Q.text: A delicious lunch with friends outdoors in the courtyard on a beautiful day.  The Churrasco was awesome.

IldA9BpHdKW6iFm9RDUaUw.text: Terrible service. Food was decent but the guy at the bar was absolutely forced to be there, which directly impacted our experience.  He was rude and wouldn't answer our simple questions about the menu.

MYj9UiTLzAfUGVe3kj16dQ.text: My wife and I ate here last week and was very impressed.   The tapas menu is excellent and makes it tough to decide.  We decided to go with the paella for our entree and it was excellent.

XnDZlxEnNKTADC20qGL-hw.text: We enjoyed the food v.much. Great steak and the champiniones were good. Small European atmosphere. Need to try again when we are more hungry

EX7dEUmOra_VggXdcJQeMg.text: Went to Malabar for the third time tonight - didn't think it was especially good the other couple of times, but it had been a year and the reviews were so good that we thought we would try it again. Unfortunately, we were really disappointed.   Firstly, they brought all of our tapas out at the same time. We have been to MANY tapas bars and they always bring the dishes as they are ready. We waited for a good 30 minutes before getting our dishes and they all came at the same time, which resulted in some being cold.  Secondly, the dishes were under-flavored. They were nowhere near the flavor profile that we have experienced from other Spanish restaurants.   The ambiance was nice - the food was just very disappointing. We will not be going back.

Ejf1edX3ULvVvbdaPZUEDA.text: Five tables open, on a Tuesday, 12:30pm. Nice Spanish guitar music. Work crowd but not packed.  Tried a few different dishes, Waiter suggested a fantastic wine. Food was wonderful as was the atmosphere. Great date place in my opinion though I went for lunch. Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sherry sauteed mushrooms, wonderful flavor and variety of mushrooms with a hint of a Smokey flavor. Yummy!

immwkoWq9OI-_FdM3vlrnA.text: We went for restaurant week last night and everything was fine.  I guess the problem was that nothing really stood out as a reason to go back.  The food was ok, service was friendly, and the atmosphere is nice (but really small).    Be careful ordering drinks off of their specialty drinks menu.  I ordered a martini that was supposed to have citron vodka.  I assumed this meant absolute vodka.  However, the bartender poured Popov instead.  And, it wasn't even citron.  Just plain old crappy Popov.  And the drink was $9.  So, I refused it and she very willingly swapped it out for a different drink.  Again, it is a nice place to go to one time.  That's all.

KsgJjw6mRqNT9SRMa2d7WQ.text: I had family in town during restaurant week and my mom suggested we try Malabar because the menu for restaurant week provided a lot of choices.  Everything we ate was delicious. In particular the croquetas and gambas al ajillo from the tapas menu were bigger than I expected.  For entrees our party of 4 tried 3 of the 5 offerings: Suquet de Mariscos, Albondigas con arroz, Mixed grill. Everything was delicious. The rice almost out-shined the albondigas. Definitely inspired me to return to try their paella.  Desserts were good- light but sweet- however, definitely not as memorable as the tapas and platos.  Music was not too loud and well-selected, playing one of my favorites from Barcelona, who had just been to CLT recently, Jarabe de Palo.  Beer selection also included a little taste of Cataluna including the more difficult to find in the States, Estrella Damm.  To sum up, the food and drinks (including an affordable wine selection by glass) would definitely bring me back for a second try.  My only negative, which may speak more to restaurant week than to Malabar, was that I did feel rushed. There definitely wasn't "sobremesa" time. The wait staff was attentive, maybe overly so. At one point the waitress tried to take my plate with my pan con tomate (which we ordered extra off the regular menu and was worth it) even before I was finished and my sangria glass when I still had some left in my glass. Not huge criticisms, but for me, one of the best parts of Spanish eating- besides the flavors- is the sharing and relaxing over delicious food without worry for time or pace.  Overall it was a great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Malabar - Charlotte, NC, United States

5Wt4RnaYHq_SD-psNoA5tw.text: Went here for New Year's Eve. This was our second visit and was just as good as the first. Started with a nice bottle of Spanish wine and then the crispy croquettes and a mushroom tapas recommended by the waitress. Both were delish!  I ordered the nightly special with red snapper and clams and mussels. Great dish. Fresh fish and a light sauce. Wife had the monk fish dish with tomatoes and chick beans. She loves this dish and has had it before. Both were super tasty. For dessert we went with tres leches and that was wonderful.   Great place with reasonable prices in uptown. Check it out.

XPM6pSOom3KC35CeA09G-g.text: Good, but not great, tapas place in the Hearst Tower. I wanted to like this more, but we just weren't crazy about our selections. Nice setting, though, and convenient to just about everything in the heart of Uptown.
